description:
Great bar.  Perfect atmosphere and a great place to have a drink while waiting for a table in North Beach/Little Italy.  

Don't mind the run down sign out front, go on in and enjoy!
author: Jeff F.

description:
Honestly, I don't know how this place has such great reviews given how creepy and aggressive the bartender is. I came here with a girlfriend and we ordered two drinks. Quick, ordered and were ready to sit down. The bartender took a look at the check after I signed it and wasn't happy with the tip I left. He said that he made an extra drink because he overheard my friend ordering from the other bartender and supposedly thought he was to make it. He told us that if we wanted that drink we needed to leave a bigger tip of $10 (which is the price of the drink). 

It was very weird and my friend and I were thrown off by how aggressive he was being, so we changed our tip amount. He then left and was nowhere to be seen.

My friend told the female bartender, "I think that is our drink. The male bartender said that we could have it because he made it as an extra." She responded, "Oh, this is for a person down the bar."  

Overall the whole interaction was very weird and really ruined my experience at this bar. Because of this I won't be returning. I've never experienced such an aggressive/sneaky bartender. He was overall just creepy. 

The drink he made was alright at $10, but it was hard to feel comfortable at that point. 

I recommend you take your business elsewhere. So many better bars on this street.
author: Mads J.

description: After a day of being a tourist, it was great to find a place to hide in with great cocktails.  Four of us showed up and no one turned around while we made our way to a back table.  After getting four signature cocktails, written right on the back mirror, we sat in the back undisturbed and laughed for hours.  What a great place!  Great cocktails, dark/cool ambiance and no one running around asking us if we wanted more of anything. If you are looking for a little spot to step out of the new world and back in the old, head to Tony Nik's for a classic drink.
author: Adam W.

description:
I love Tony Nik's....it has a vibe and feel of what    North Beach used to be like.

Our Friends had made reservations next door, at North Beach restaurant, and we were a tad early....heck I'll use any excuse to stop by a bar.

My Friend is friendly with Butch the owner and wanted to see if he was in...he wasn't but the place was hopping with friendly locals.

I had a great stoli Martini and the two ladies had Margaritas ( why anyone would get a marg at Tony Nik's is beyond me).

Drinks are reasonable priced still.

Bartenders are great.

Music is fun.

Caveat: really small bar with minimal seating.

If you are visiting  SF stop by to an historical spot....you could even tell all your food snobby friends you drank at the original french Laundry (okay well Madam Nicco's French Laundry)...Tomato Tomatoe
author: David G.

description: Terrific place to stop in and have a drink or two. I would recommend this place to any of my friends visiting North Beach. Wonderful service and great conversation by the barkeeps, especially Sebastian.
author: Dennis C.

description:
Tony Nik's may be favorite bar in SF at the moment. This place looks like your typical dive bar from the outside but on the inside is this old school, classy bar with the friendliest Bartenders you will ever meet. A and I were able to snag a few seats at the end of the bar. The tables in the back of Tony Nik' were rented out for a 40th birthday party but I am sure that is a nice place to hang out with a date. The space is dark and intimate, the perfect place to take your SO.

We ordered from the cocktail menu written on the board (apparently they always have the same cocktails and just changed the name for the holidays) and chatted with the bartender as he made our drinks. He was really personable and spent a lot of time crafting our cocktails. At the standard SF $12, these were quality drinks. We were really enjoying the vibe at Tony Nik's so decided to order another round as we finished ours. A ordered another one of the cocktails on the mirror whereas I decided to try my luck and order a Matador. A Matador is a cocktail I had in Osaka 1 month prior at a similar bar and is a classic cocktail with Tequila, Pineapple Juice and Lime Juice. I thoroughly enjoyed it in Japan so I figured that a classy bar like Tony Nik's would be able to recreate it. The bartender didn't know what the drink was but offered to try his hand at making it since he had all of the ingredients on hand. 

He did his best but unfortunately, the drink was TERRIBLE. Not enough lime juice and it tasted like rotten sun tan lotion. A and I just paid and I resolved to finish it since I wasn't going to complain over something where the bartender had tried his best. After about 5 minutes, our bartender checked up on us and specifically on how I enjoyed my drink. Something you should know about me, fellow Yelpers, is that I cannot lie with a straight face. He immediately saw I didn't like it and instantly offered to try again since he was determined to make the drink correctly.  He immediately went to work and used more lime juice (plus upgraded my Tequila from the well - thanks!!) and the new drink was 10x better. Now that is AMAZING customer service which really is difficult to find. I learned my lesson to not order Matadors but even more than that, we gained a new favorite bar. If you are in the North Beach area and are looking for a place to have a few nice, calm drinks, you need to stop in.
author: Carrie W.

description: This bar has a great atmosphere! It's longer than it is wide and surprisingly has a lot of seating towards the back. The bartender was amazing. They have a small menu but if they can make it for you, they will. And they'll keep making things for you until you like it. 10/11 would recommend.
author: Juliette S.

description:
Thanks David, great start to a birthday weekend. Friendly & knowledgeable & makes a great drink!! 
Nice little locals place on a busy Columbus Avenue
author: Rick C.

description: One of our favorite stops in North Beach! Clean bar and bathrooms, friendly bartenders, reasonable prices. A nice retro vibe.
author: Christi Y.

description: Great little hidden gem. Super bar staff with delicious cocktails. Gets pretty busy at the end of a working day with locals.
author: Madison S.

description:
A bit of a throw back bar tucked away in North Beach - stopped for a real cocktail - bartender was super nice, crowd was fun and the drink was really good.
This is not a cafe though, no food.
But looks like it still was exactly as it probably was back in the 50's.
Fun stop
author: Tina O.

description:
This bar has been in this location since 1933 and from what I could tell from my brief visit (2-beers, my only 2-beers), they would prefer to go back to that time when San Francisco was just a bunch of gold-diggers and local yokels.

I was 86'd for talking too loud.  zI'll admit, I was born in the Northeast and have a loud voice but I was not obnoxious, rude, vulgar, nor offensive.  I was merely excited by the conversation I was having with other customers (A woman, her daughter, & the daughters fiance).

All was well, I was seated at the bar, right next to the door, engaged in conversation when the bartender came up and told me to "dial it back" a bit.  I thought he was kidding and said 2 words:  "What flavor?"  I was then told to drink my beer and leave?  Seriously?  Like that?  

When I apologized, for maybe having offended him on some way, He responded, "You haven't shut up since you got here."  

I tried to diffuse the situation by explaining I grew up in the Northeast and had a penchant for speaking in a loud voice but did not intend to offend him.  He replied, Why don't you go back there."  I knew then this was a real loser.  Nice hair, good Manhattans, extremely self-centered idiot.  "This is my bar..." kind of mentality from a bartender who has obviously spent most of his life pretending to be a nice guy than actually learning how that comes about.

I may have been unintentionally loud, but he was being intentionally rude and arrogant.

When I first arrived, 4-ladies walked in for a drink, each with these funny looking antenna like headgear, each slightly different.  They stayed for 1 drink and left...I asked, "What's with the antenna?"  He replied, "They're a bit ditsy."  I said, "I don't know, it looked like they were having some sort of ladies night out thing, like a birthday or some other celebration.  

He said, "Their too old to be acting so young and having so much fun."

Seriously, absolutely incredible...

I would definitely return, to get his name and the owner's number...
author: Charles L.

description: Tony Mik's is probably my favorite bar in North Beach! Delicious cocktails but in a relaxed atmosphere, and I love how there's the traditional bar area up front (often with the giants on) that's complemented by the more loungey area in the back - all while keeping a down to earth neighborhood vibe. Strongly recommend the Moscow Mule!
author: Holly L.

description:
Small, quaint, intimate bar! 

We stumbled here randomly after eating Golden Boy Pizza, and ever since then it's been a routine. The bartenders are awesome, the drinks are pretty good, and the vibes are definitely something else!
author: Catherine T.

description: This place's mood is dependent on who's working behind the stick.   Run if you see the old pathetic white haired bitter old man.    Pathetic at best.  Stay if you see the young lady.  Watch your wallet when the middle aged guy is behind the bar.  He'll steal from you.
author: Eddie J.

description:
Feels like a classy dive bar. LOVE it!

The drinks are okay, but the bar staff are consistently socially intelligent and all the old codgers sitting at the bar are entertaining.
author: Brian M.

description: Come here for a legit cocktail. Atmosphere is dark and the place is small, which adds to the charm. Chilled glasses and great bartenders complete the effect.
author: Christin J.

description: Check this out anything with the name Tony is freaking awesome. Yeah i said that lol this place rocks. This place is slim dark and cozy just how i like it. Once again nothing was crazy busy on this tuesday night so we got A1 service. The crew sat close to the door so some of us could drink and catch those dang Pokemon. After putting back a few i found that i was in love with the St. Ruby.This will definitely be my new north beach pitstop.
author: Tony B.

description: Super friendly bartender (the first after a dozen bars on this trip), yummy cocktails, a TV for the men who want to watch sports, laid back! Locals seem to pass in and out of out here too!
author: Fran C.

description:
TL;DR: don't go here with a group or the grumpy bartender will yell at you for enjoying life. 

A friend was in town and we decided to bar hop in North Beach. We stopped in here with a group of about 10 and sat in the lounge area deciding what to order. The bartender came over and YELLED at us because we dared to speak in "his bar". Listen you grumpy mcgrumperson, you are in the service industry and if you don't want groups in your bar then make that clear. This dude was an epic asshole and we ended up walking out. I'd understand if we were screaming, but we were laughing about what shots to get and we were all the way in the corner. It was also early afternoon (4pm or so) and not very crowded. Again, this bartender was an ASSHOLE and I will not tolerate bad service. It's a bar, not a place of worship. We voted with our money and went to Pete's right around the corner where the service, food and drinks was impeccable. 

I very rarely give 1 stars and I don't ever go in on reviews like this but I will say it again, this guy was an EPIC ASSHOLE and they don't deserve your money. There are way too many options in N. Beach to tolerate this. #ByeFelicia
author: Bianca B.

description: We stumbled upon this spot while visiting SF for the weekend, we will definitely return. This isn't a dive bar, but it's not super hoity toity either. When we walked in we were told it was more of an Industry Bar, which worked for us! The cocktails were excellent, great selection of alcohol and mixers, very good service.
author: Lindsay Y.

description:
This bar is unassuming, and I love it! It's pretty dark inside but not crowded at all. We were able to take over the back part which easily fits a huge group of folks. They play lounge music but the place isn't too loud. 

The bar tender was also very funny and personable. They have amazing cocktails for $10. This place is perfect for a chill night when you wanna catch up w an old friend or on a business trip!
author: Joy-Alonica B.

description: This used to be a favorite old time SF joint that we loved to go because of the people and not all the pretentiousness of other places in the city. But over the years it has grown to be dirty and smells like urine. Some of the staff are just not pleasant to be around. The daytime bartender on weekends is one grumpy dude that has worked there forever but has recently been just outright rude and makes your stay seem unpleasant. If your visiting during the day I would suggest you go to one of the other local bars like Gino and Carlos, Columbus Cafe or Original Joes. These places have the Authentic old time SF feel are much cleaner and have much better upbeat attitude.
author: Chris K.

description:
A perfect mix.

Classy but comfortable.
It's an easy backdrop for the show Mad Men, but Harley dudes are just as likely to hang here, too.

They do classic cocktails, & beer & shots w equal dedication.

It's a true neighborhood bar, but tourists are welcome, & made to feel that way.

There's the front window & bar for your sociable times, & the tables & booths for your more private times.

The bartenders are knowledgeable, but they're also accommodating.  From Sebastian, to Devon, to David, they all really know their stuff.  If you want a top notch negroni, you're gonna get one.  But if you want something obscure, they're game for that, too.

It's called a cafe because back in the day, a bar couldn't obtain a liquor license unless it served food.  TN's doesn't serve food, but it's cool for you to grab something from nearby (a slice from Tony's, a sandwich from Mario's) & eat it here.

Bonus...the music.  David worked in music for decades; from the Whiskey A Go Go in LA (among others), to the SF Symphony.  It's never boring.

A must for a cocktail in NB.

5 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: Ambience is nice..it is like a cozy, neighborhood bar in the heart of North Beach. But be prepared to wait with only one bartender and a packed house.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: I should give it a one star so that it will NOT change the atmosphere. This is a local neighborhood bar that does NOT need a group of rowdy drinkers ruining the chill vibe. This place is good as is. It's a place to come and unwind and have a good time with having a few drinks and chatting with your friends.
author: Tom P.

description:
Things you should know:

1.  The sign out front is original and dates back to the 1930's.  It's one of the oldest in North Beach.

2.  The word "cafe" appears on that sign, a relic from a time when establishments serving alcohol were also required to serve food.  Tony Nik's serves no food.   

3.  Tony Nik's serves fabulous cocktails.  I can personally vouch several times over for the quality of their Moscow Mule ($9).     

4.  Said cocktails are created by cool, unpretentious, bartenders lacking hipster credentials.  This is a plus.  The bartenders are skilled at "surprise me" orders so go ahead, live dangerously.  

5.  A lack of hipster credentials doesn't imply a non-hipster crowd but the night I visited it was a perfect mix of ages (20s thru 60s) and types (locals, tourists, suburban, urban, hipster, and non).

6.  Tony Nik's soundtrack is infectious.  Fantastic music to accompany your imbibing but tuned to a pitch over which one can still hold a conversation.

7.  What looks from the outside to be dated will cause those not in the know to walk on by.  Adventurous souls and those with insider knowledge will walk in, belly up to the bar, and groove in the mid-century lounge ambiance.  This is possibly the coolest bar in North Beach.   

6.  Credit cards accepted only for charges exceeding $20.
author: Tracey A.

description: If you are a local, this is a great place to run into familiar faces, and if you are a visitor, no problem! The drinks are great no matter what and the bartenders are as friendly as they come.
author: Afshin A.

description: Great local bar. Friendly staff, friendly crowd. Great location near Washington Square and Coit Tower.  Grab a drink and relax before dinner at a local Italian restaurant.
author: Scott M.

description:
If you're standing in the rain in front of Tony's Pizza Napoletana and are reading this. I know a place that's warm, serves delicious cocktails and just a few short steps from Tony's where you can dry off and drink a tasty bourbon drink while you wait for your table.

Leave your cell phone number with the hostess and head over to Tony Nik's Cafe. It's the perfect place to sit and sip and discuss your pizza plan of attack. The vibe is casual and there is usually plenty of space to scoot up at the bar or just head for one of the tables and be prepared drink away.
author: Rene C.

description:
Time warp!  It looks like the 60s or 70s in here, in a good way.

Came by here while we were waiting for a table at Tony's pizza on the corner.  And found one of the most knowledgeable friendly bartenders ever.  We had a couple drinks he recommended based on our tastes... forget the names but one included St Germain and vodka with a prosecco float and the other was gin, chartreuse, lime and something.  Both were delic.
author: Aaron M.

description: Awesomely solid neighborhood chill spot. Not pretentious and just solid drinks and bartend. Looks like nothing from the outside but swanky once you step in.
author: May W.

description: Used to be one of my favorite north beach bars until I had a bad experience. Bought a slice of Tony's and wanted to go get a beer and the bar tender kicked us out in a rude way for having pizza. They don't serve food, what's the disadvantage for the bar? Pizza boxes? More business? Disappointed
author: Scott S.

description: Sebastian is the man. Very knowledgeable on his bourbon and super kind. Definitely will come back when I'm in town from NY.
author: Paul K.

description: We had an amazing time at Tony Nik's during San Francisco Fleet Week. My friend and I had been wandering around the neighborhood looking for a fun place to hang out and the dark, unassuming entrance called to us. The staff was so much fun. They were friendly and made delicious cocktails. The crowd was just the right size and was just as friendly and low-key as the bar itself. Couldn't have asked for a better place to get to know the people of San Francisco - we'll certainly be back during our next trip!
author: Jon P.

description: I love, love, love, this bar!! Great bartender (David) that knows how to make all the great traditional drinks. If you like a great bar that has that New York/Boston pub feel, you will really enjoy Tony Nik's.
author: Mary H.

description: A comfortable and classy place for a late night drink.  Beautiful wood paneling and intimate lighting makes for a great atmosphere.  The sound system is perfect; there is no need to shout to hear the person next to you.  A thoroughly comfortable and enjoyable cocktail bar.  Sebastian mixes a great drink that would easily run you 50% more somewhere else.
author: Justina L.

description:
Tony Nic's Café is a bar with a misleading name located in the old Italian neighborhood of North Beach.  The host of Café DeLucchi located across the street recommended it to me for before-dinner drinks.  It's has been operating since the early 1930s and retains the look and ambiance from that era.  Walk in and you'll think that you stepped back 90 years in time.  It has an interesting history that can be checked out on the Web.

This joint is everything that a cocktail lounge should be.  The front entrance wall consists of translucent glass block.  It opens to a long narrow room with a lengthy wood bar up front and tables and chairs in back complemented by walls clad in dark wood paneling.  It is fairly quiet and the lighting subdued. 

We took a couple of seats at the bar and soon learned that our bartender was a professional - knowledgeable, efficient, highly skilled in the art of cocktail preparation, and very personable.  He whipped up a couple of cocktails for us that were perfectly made and delicious.  The cost was very reasonable, and on the occasion of our visit the clientele was friendly and polite.

We enjoyed Tony Nic's Café immensely, and I was sorry to leave it for dinner.  I very much liked everything about it and will return anytime I get the chance.
author: Michael D.

description:
If by "Cafe" you mean "Shot Gun Bar".  

And by "Shot Gun Bar" I mean "My Favorite Shot Gun Bar".  

Great bar tenders who are friendly, knowledgeable, and make really great drinks.  No frills or thrills.  A few specialty cocktails written on the mirror that are always good too.  But I'd say this is one of those spots for the bar lover who knows their drink and wants it made well. 

Always clean. Always warm and cozy.  Always friendly.

In the spirit of the phrase "A man's man", Tony Nik's Cafe is North Beach's "A Bar's Bar."  There are the regulars and the pre-partiers.  The bachelors and the business men.  Girls meeting up for GNO and all manner of couples. 

Just note, they have the worlds smallest bathrooms.  It's actually quite extraordinary how small they are.
author: Susan C.

description: This place is great!! We went here for first visit on Halloween yesterday and had a fun time with friends and family. It's a clean establishment with a nice selection of thirst quenchers. I forgot my sport coat and Seb was very helpful with retrieval. It's a must visit and We'll definitely come back for the awesome service!! Thank you very much! My girlfriend, Kay deserves a high five for the initial message phone call to Seb!! Thank you!! Yay!
author: Yip J.

description: The patrons and bartender, Sebastian, are wonderful.  Welcoming, friendly, and great conversation.  Sebastian makes amazing cocktails.
author: David P.

description:
3 stars for the drinks, 4 stars for the vibe. 

Reminds me of Bruno's because it looks ghetto and divey on the outside, but it's actually quite nice on the inside. They have a small menu of interesting cocktails, which I can't say were anywhere near the quality of a drink from Bourbon, Rickhouse, Tradition, Rye... but it's a great unpretentious alternative for cocktails in the North Beach area.

The whiskey bourbon cocktail was actually really good even though I don't usually like whiskey, and I didn't like my vodka-based drink, Halo, at all even though I usually love vodka. So give Tony Nik's a shot, and try drinks outside your comfort zone!
author: Jess C.

description:
We stopped in here for drinks while waiting for a table at Tony's down the street.

The bartender was nice, made a good drink, and did it pretty quickly.

I'm guessing this used to be an old man bar, and is now a little updated and more trendy.

A good place to have a cocktail, it definitely has more of a neighborhood feel to it, versus the tourist vibe a lot of North Beach bars and restaurants have.
author: Amanda G.

description: Sebastian is an amazing bartender!! Tell him what you like and he can create something you never knew you needed, but now you can't live without. They serve Pushback wines too, which those who know GET it.
author: S T.

description:
We stepped in here while we were waiting TWO HOURS for a table at the pizzeria down the street (more on that in a different review!) It looked really unprepossessing from the outside, but once we ventured in, it turned into a really beautiful bar with lovely decor and a very nice atmosphere. 

I love sitting up at bars and talking to the barman - so we did just that, and I was keen to try a cocktail or two - so we did just that too! I went for one of the specials written on the board - some sort of orange citrus martini thingy. It was delicious, and the barman was extremely obliging - putting a couple of maraschino cherries in my drink because I love them! I then tried an old fashioned, and that too was delicious. They were not cheap, but man those drinks were good!

I really liked the music that they were playing - lots of recognisable, but not cheesy songs. The place seemed to be filled with grown-ups who wanted to relax and talk, and the whole experience was very pleasant. 

My only complaint was that I was far too cold. The door was kept open the whole time, and 8pm in San Francisco at any time of the year is chilly... If they could sort the temperature out, this would be a fantastic place.
author: Emma M.

description: If you only go to one bar in North Beach, Tony Nik's should be it.  What a classy, cozy and inviting joint.  The old school decor and history brought us in, but what made this place so special were the friendly, local patrons (most of who live or work in the neighborhood), genteel blue eyed bartender, and the mellow/intimate vibe.  No TVs, just ppl taking a break to enjoy a drink and good conversation. What a gem.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Tony Nik's is a dope spot to kill time whilst waiting to dine at overrated restaurants that aren't worth your money. I'm talking one and a half hours here honey and it ain't right to keep me stahhhhvin that long. 

Tony Nik's to the rescue!! 3 cocktails, a gin + tonic and a Jameson coke for only $40? WHOA.
I must be totally used to douchebag bar/lounge prices because that seemed so cheap to me. 

Bartender is a super sweetheart. The brunette one.. I didn't catch her name (sorry) but thanks for carding me! I love it (Thank you Asian genes). She was super nice too and made great recommendations to my friends on the cocktails. 

If I was in this area again, I'd definitely hit up Tony Nik's. It is very small but if you're only here with a small number of people, you should be fine.

Oh, and they're totally cool about you eating pizza from next door in here.
author: Susy C.

description:
My wife and I were visiting from out of town and walked in to this place totally on advice of Yelp. We were not disappointed. Darren was a great bartender and he mixed up two nice drinks at a good price in no time. 

Even on a Sunday night, It's a cool mix of a throwback casual style with hip friendly people to meet. Definitely recommended.
author: Gerald H.

description: I love this spot, very chill environment in a crazy town lol. Good Whisky selection and the bar tender has great stories.
author: Caleb B.

description: Oh, this place is charming. Mid-century modern decor. Genuinely friendly bartender. Mellow, interesting crowd. I must go back soon.
author: P S.

description: This place is a gem- great cocktails and ambiance and somehow missed by all the tourists so much more local feel. Go and explore the cocktails!
author: Allie M.

description: Loved the dim lighting, loved the bartendress, loved the two topped candle-lit tables. Great for dates or intense conversation partners, not for groups. Cocktails are unique, well presented and smooth. However, you get about 4 oz less of liquid than you might at a similarly tasty establishment for $13.
author: Andres B.

description: Great dive bar.  Devon is not only a awesome bartender/mixologist but she is a great friend.  Mostly locals come here but during the weekends the place attracts everyone and all kind of folks.
author: Liz D.

description: This lil hole in the wall spot is great.  Our bartender was a bit "douchey" when I noticed a rare bottle of tequila on his shelf, he had a real "this is MY HOOD" attitude.  I laughed and enjoyed my company and the ambiance.  We ordered a few Grey Goose martinis and headed to the back of the bar.  They have a really cool area for seating.  It is just down from the bar which gets busy at times because this isn't a big place.  I love that a bunch of "tourists" don't know about this place, because it has a real local feel and that is what I am going for when I am in from out of town.  One drink was enough to move on to the next stop, but Tony Nik's will definitely be on our list to stop again when we get back to San Fran.
author: Brian H.

description:
Tony Niks is a mix of both classy and eclectic. The vibe of the bar is a 1960's feel. Tony Niks is a local bar where one can step away from the tourist infested North Beach area. The bartenders are laid back, relaxed and attentive. They love their jobs, and I could tell that they have been there for awhile! 

This is a no frills and thrills bar. Not for the Marina crowd. I usually come here for a neat pour of Whiskey, which is fair and reasonably priced compared to the rest of the city at $7. Also the beer and shot combo is $11. They also offer a selection of crafty cocktails, for groups of people with different tastes for alcohol. It's a great  hangout before or after dinner. It is never crowded, and always welcoming.
author: Kimberly G.

description: I absolutely love Tony Nik's! It's a small, cozy, friendly neighborhood bar in North Beach. I love the decor and cool vibe here. Day or evening, its my go to when I'm in town for a yummy cocktail.
author: Sariah D.

description: My choice for a neighborhood bar in the Russian Hill / North Beach area. I came here on a Monday night, mainly while we waited for Tony's Pizza next door. It's a great place to unwind, as it's not at all crowded, with just enough people to make it feel cozy but you can use your normal conversation voice. Bartender was very laid back and made drinks meticulously. Definitely would come again
author: Melissa T.

description:
Stopped in here a couple weeks ago after hitting the Park Tavern (old Moose's where I used to work) and realized that has got to be one of my favorite bars in San Francisco. 

Devon was there - of course, and she rocks. I just love this place and if you're reading this - go check it out. It's a dynamite bar - lounge type of atmosphere. There never seems to be any 'tool bags' in here. Just good people that are cool to talk too - with awesome bartenders pouring great drinks. 

This is a can't miss kind of place.
author: Rew C.

description:
2.5 but a 3.0 because I'm feeling generous. If I rated places on looks I would give it a 4. But nothing real special going on here. I asked the bartender for a good IPA and he looked at me like a deer in the headlights. 
Am I a beer snob? Yes! Should a bartender know what a good IPA is?...Yes! Especially if it's on the tap. Which it was. Maybe I shouldn't rate this place because of their lack of beer selection. 
He asked me "how was it because I've never had it?"........Ehhhhh no bueno!
Decided to try a cocktail on the menu and it was way too sweet.... Kind or lame. The bathroom is pathetic. Extremely small.....take a piss, wash my hands, take a deuce and while I have someone watch me ALL at the same time. I felt bad for the group that was sitting at the table just a few feet from the door.....enough said. 
Overall.......meh.
author: Tony C.

description: This place is a throwback to the time when lounges ruled. Great spot to bring a date for pre-dinner drinks, or to meet up with friends to enjoy some classy cocktails.
author: Peter G.

description: Throwback to a different era of SF in this place. Art deco style mixed with nothing-fancy-but-still-damn-good cocktails makes it a great place to kick back a few on a rainy night. It wasn't even that packed for a Friday night and you could actually hear what the person was saying next to you. The small bar of the city's past is slowly going away, but Tony Nik's is a place takes you back to a genuinely classy bar who's class act comes naturally.
author: Jake A.

description: Cool atmosphere great location excellent service reasonable prices what else do you want. Do not let the marque fool you. Go in.
author: E F.

description:
By far my favorite bar in North Beach.

I'd been out in NB once before, and was ready to write it off forever. So glad I didn't. 

Tony Nik's is upscale and classy, almost reminiscent of a hotel bar. Yet the prices are on par with other spots in the city and the drinks are exceptionally well-made. I think I ordered the Pegu Club (?) with gin and lemon juice and some other mystery ingredient (forgive me, I was already tipsy before entering). It was sour and won my heart.

It very much felt like a neighborhood bar -- the ambiance was quiet yet welcoming, and the other patrons were friendly. Great spot for a date, or to catch up with a smaller group of friends.
author: Tiffany W.

description:
Love Tony Nik's! The bartenders are AWESOME! I always have a good time with them here. Great spot to meet a date, too. 
Only downside, and absolutely not their fault, there is a douche beacon at this place. Barney's who have never gone out in their life or guys wearing suits that they assume entitle them to be womanizing pricks. It's weird. I think Amante's and Tony's have the same beacon. 
Anyway, if you can avoid that, good times are to be had here and the drinks are phenomenal!!
author: Dee H.

description:
Checked out this place when we went to SF and fell in love. Filled with locals who helped us find some new bars/restaurants to navigate artound the city. We drank here for hours and talked with the bartender. Everyone was super friendly, and the drinks were strong and good. 

One main reason why I loved this place. A few guys came stumbling in and started hitting on this girl at the bar and touching her. The bartender took one look at them, and asked the girl if she knew them. She said 'No' - and he kicked them out right away in front of the entire bar. A bartender that pours good drinks, is friendly, and watches out for his patrons? I'M IN.

Wish I could come here everyday for an after work drink, but I live a little too far ;)
author: Ashley H.

description: Nothing special. Drinks are reasonably priced but not much kick. There was elevator music playing and a few bare tables in a bare, dark room. I would not come back considering all the lively nearby cafés, pubs, and bars.
author: Steffi F.

description: One of the best places in North Beach to have a drink on a date.  Great atmosphere and really great music choices.  The bartenders are friendly and professional.  The owner is friendly and a local business man from the area
author: Dave T.

description: It's fine... just don't ever ask to watch a game on the telly. The attitude that will ensue is pretty d#%^ unreal.
author: Anne S.

description: Got roared at by bartender Sebastian as coworker from UK left $2 tip on five drinks. Not a pleasant way to treat an out of towner unfamiliar with US tipping policy. Spoilt an otherwise pleasant visit to Tony and Nik's. Sebastian - maybe you were having a bad night but that wasn't cool.
author: Tim L.

description:
I struggled between 4 and 5 stars for Tony Nik's. I'll have to go with 4, only because I didn't get a chance to interact with the bartenders since my friends did all the ordering. I hope to chat them up next time and hopefully update my review.

Came in on a Saturday night with two of my friends. With an unassuming entrance in the middle of North Beach, the bar looks like a dive from the outside. It's quite the contrary.

Inside, the decor is clean, classy and clearly modern. It's longer than it is wide. The actual bar lines the left side as you walk in; there are small tables in the back with some booth seating.

Again, my friends ordered so I can't comment on the bartenders. However, they do make some great classic drinks! We ordered the following: old fashioned, martini, negroni, gin and tonic, and a whiskey on the rocks. All of them were very good. My negroni was craftily blended, smooth and strong.

The general atmosphere is pleasant, especially when you consider it's in the middle of a rowdy district. It's laid-back, and both the older and younger crowds seem to coexist peacefully. Scattered throughout are couples/two person groups and larger parties. Everyone seemed to be having a good time. They keep the music at a decent volume that still allows for great conversation.

This place has the thinnest bathrooms I've ever seen! There's one per gender. There actually ended up being a line for the men's while we were there, which I thought was unusual.

It never got too crowded (although we didn't stay super late). There was always room in the back. I think my friends and I had a fantastic time - and I expect to return often.
author: Alyssa W.

description:
We came here because we needed to kill two hours while waiting for our table at Tony's Pizza next door. Its a pretty average bar with decent prices (especially for San Francisco). It can get a little crowded but we were lucky enough to find a table at the back of the bar. The only downside was that there was only one bartender when we ordered our drinks and he messed up our orders a couple of times. 

Overall, an okay place to wait for your table!
author: Krishna S.

description:
I love this place. It'd been a long time since I'd been in, but had an opportunity to down a few drinks here this month during SantaCon.  Firstly, service was very quick even though they were overrun with Santas. Friendly, too.  Prices are pretty fair, especially compared to other bars in the immediate vicinity.  I was drinking double call drinks and I think they were around $8.  Strong pours. I needn't have been drinking doubles, really...

The jukebox: I think I remarked on the jukebox during *every song*.  It is fantastic.  There is quite a bit of seating even though it's a small and narrow space.  Only con to the layout are that the bar can get really crowded when they're busy since there is not a lot of spare room for people entering and exiting the bar. 

I left wondering why I hadn't been back here in so long... "I'll be back."
author: Heidi M.

description:
Wow, people should not judge this place by the sign!  I came here with my boyfriend and some friends for some drinks after dinner.  As soon as we walked in, I noticed a nice bar near the walkway.  There were a few tables and chairs for customers to enjoy their drinks.  We all decided to sit at the tables near the back of the cafe.  I liked how there are tiny candles on each table.  It was definitely a dim and 
romantic setting. =)  This bar also plays music kind of loud, so it feels like a club..lol.

Since I read a lot of great things about the 'lemon drops', my boyfriend wanted to try it for his birthday.  One of my friends got him the lemon drop, and he loved it!  The drink was placed in a nice martini glass with a slice of lemon on the side. (See picture)

I decided to buy my boyfriend a drink for his birthday.  He told me that he wanted a 'rum with coke'.  I walked up to the bartender and ordered it.  When the bartender asked me 'what type of rum?', I was a bit confused..lol.  Since I actually don't drink, I went back to my boyfriend to ask him what kind of rum..lol.  After asking all my friends and boyfriend for the rum type, they told me to get 'Captain Morgan'.

 I walked back to the bartender and said 'Captain Morgan!'. =)  The bartender asked if I wanted lime.  Again, I was confused..lol.  The bartender was nice enough to put it on the side, so I didn't have to go back to my boyfriend to ask.  The rum & coke cost $6, and my boyfriend enjoyed it.  

I noticed at around 10pm, the bar got really packed and super loud.  Since we couldn't really hear ourselves talking, we decided to leave.

Overall, this is definitely a great bar!
author: Rita V.

description:
Chill, laid back classy bar! Great place to have a drink and a decent conversation!

You would not be able to tell from the outside, but this is a very well maintained bar on the inside. There is a long bar at the front and a few candle-lit tables and lounge seating  in the back.  

I went on a Wednesday evening and it was full but not crowded.  The bartender makes a mean cocktail and is friendly. 

A cocktail will run from $8-11.
author: Julie J.

description: The other night I saw a pretty big roach scurrying across the bar.  I didn't say anything to the staff because Sebastian is the king of snarky douchebag bartending and I knew he'd blame me for it, or tell me I was seeing things.  Didn't want to deal with him so I'll just let everyone here know.  Yes, this place is very dark for a reason.
author: Kyle K.

description:
I went here last night to unwind a bit and the place did not disappoint. I had a Guatemala Limonade or something (a rum drink), and it was well made. I followed up with a Manhattan which was also expertly made. What I liked is that the bartender  asked me what kind of gin I wanted, and gave me some options. I said I wanted some olives in it because that's how I roll, and he said that Hendricks would not be a good option because Hendricks has cucumber flavor or somesuch. He recommended Plymouth and it turned out well. 

What I liked is that he did not talk down on me, he was just a friendly guy. He came by to check up on us periodically but was not pushy. 

Drinks are OK priced, not too cheap, not mind-blowingly expensive. 

We were lucky to score two bar seats towards the end of the bar, but I saw a lot of people standing around. 

The music was nice in that it was not overbearing. ESPN was on the TV but thankfully the sound wasn't on.
author: Vic P.

description: Went in for a drink while waiting on a table for Tony's. Tried taking pictures and they don't like that. Poured out our drinks and asked us to leave. Very weird.  Never would have happen in Texas.   Will never go there again.
author: Diana M.

description:
Tony Nik's is one of those neighborhood staples.  The bartenders are true professionals.  The drinks are stiff.  The clientele is classy.

Shout out to Sebastian.  Congrats on the addition to your family!

It's a long, narrow bar, and I've seen bigger bathrooms on a plane.  There is seating in the back for groups of friends, and a good number of seats at the bar.  Get there too late, and it's standing room only.  Great place for a cocktail in North Beach.
author: Peter M.

description: Coolest bar to stumble upon. My boyfriend and I happened in to this bar based on a local's recommendation. The drinks are flawless and all thanks to the bartender, Sebastian. I had my first Moscow Mule and it was delicious. Great drinks and great, friendly bartenders.
author: Hannah V.

description:
Great old school style bar. Great lighting and an eclectic mix of patrons. The bar tenders are courteous and capable. 

I love the neon sign.
author: Dusty B.

description: Amazing hidden gem! Bartender is very knowledgeable! He knows his ish! Very dim, hipster, lighting and mood. Great music. Some blues, zombies...drinks are very very creative. I ordered the "Evita" soooo darn amazing to my palette! Definite must!!!!
author: Jez G.

description: David is one of the very best & knowledgeable bartenders in San Francisco!  Lucky to have met him.
author: Vince C.

description:
Been coming here for years.  Something about the colors and darkness inside always reminds me of a place in Southern Cal that I used to go to years ago called Rebecca's.  That was a long time ago and believe that although the place is long gone now, their claim to fame was the lime green banquette seating there that was used in the film, Less Than Zero.  Or so I was always told.

Anyway, when the music gets a little too loud at The Saloon down the street and the crowd a little too crazy at Gino & Carlo, Tony Nik's has always been the perfect place for me to enjoy a good drink.  A nice, dark, and relaxed little establishment that I have used as my escape to bar for years, Tony Nik's is a North Beach icon.  Definitely one of the classier bars in the area in which to imbibe.

I'd forgotten how much I used to like this place.  Used to come here a lot more in the past, but somehow I moved on to the next big thing...I definitely need to come back and spend more time hanging out here in the near future.

After a drink at Gino & Carlo, this was stop number four the other night on a fun Sunday evening of barhopping in North Beach.

Just for fun, here's a list of places we hopped that evening:

Larry Flynt's (UYE)
The Saloon
Gino & Carlo
Tony Nik's Lounge
The Boardroom
Bix
Golden Boy

If that wasn't an eclectic drinking itinerary, I don't know what is!
author: Roy N.

description:
My friend turned me onto this little gem and have since made it a destination whenever I happen to be in town. Bartenders are very friendly and speaking for myself I haven't been disappointed with any drink I've ordered.

The place itself is spotless and has a definite 60's retro feel to it that love. Great place to meet up and unwind after a long day or even a meeting place before heading out for a night on the town.
author: David B.

description: This is a great little place, and it's the perfect spot to wait for your table to open up at Tony's. Love the throwback decor, cool bartender, and tasty cocktail specials. It has a really nice relaxed feel and the Moscow Mule is excellent.
author: Rachel M.

description: Came here to have a few drinks while we were waiting on a pizza next door! Good drinks, awesome bartender..will definitely be back when we come this way again! Oh & you Can't complain about the complimentary chips & salsa ;)
author: Stephanie M.

description: Love this place. Great cocktails, a fun crowd and the bartenders are always a great time.
author: Samantha H.

description:
"When you see the sign, you won't want to come in. Keeps the wrong crowd out & the right one in." 

True, true, true, feels like you've dropped onto a Mad Men set unexpectedly in North Beach (with some retro, 70's artifacts still kicking about). A stiff drink, some sweet tunes, & charming banter. Head over on Mondays for Victor.

"Where everybody knows your name, and they're always glad you came." And you'll be, too.
author: Sushmita M.

description:
I hate to give away my usual hangouts in the City, but since there are a whopping 135 reviews of Tony N's, I guess I'm not giving away much at this point.

For me North Beach is far from tolerable on the weekends, but a great place to hang out weeknights.  Tony Nik's is great for many reasons.  It's small, unassuming, it has a core of regulars, and that really makes you feel like N. Beach is still a real neighborhood.  

The bathrooms are SUPER tiny.  Like something you would see on a train or a propeller DC 9 plane.  If you can get there between 4-6pm on a weekday, grab a spot at the bar, keep the vibe friendly, and keep it real.  Oh, and enjoy the cocktails!
author: Marcos R.

description:
Unexpected delight was discovered at Tony Nik's Cafe. The bartender was cool and friendly and worth talking to. The drinks were not badly priced for the area. The bathroom was small.

I loved everything I did here and everyone I talked to. Come on now, you know! Come on down and drink with your chill self.
author: Alexander R.

description:
Whatever happens in Tony Nik's, stays in Tony Nik's.

We live a block away, so this has become an extension of my living room. I go there with my husband, I go there without my husband. My husband goes there without me. Or with me.
Or we go with friends.
If there would be any other way of going there, we would do that too.

Sebastian is the best, and the rest of the guys are true stars too.

PS: This bar proved to be the best thing that could have happened to me the time my mother-in-law came to stay with us for a few weeks.
author: Daisy B.

description:
Awesome bartenders make this place a true gem of the neighborhood!
We were visiting from NY for the weekend, and loved this place so much that we went back twice!
Bartenders are SUPER friendly and will cater to your liking like mad scientists!
Just tell them what you like and they will concoct elixirs for your pleasure!
Drinks are about $10-$14, but well worth it.  If you don't like something, they will change it.
Have fun and try the pizza next door too!
author: T B.

description:
By far, my favorite and fabulous lounge in North Beach where the locals hang. 

Sebastian manages the place and he's what make the customers keep on coming back. Besides serving a good drink, Sebastian is a good family/business man who is highly respected in San Francisco. He remembers who you are, what you like to drink and introduces you to other locals in the bar. 

I definitely recommend anyone visiting from out of town or local to check this place out!
author: Tami P.

description:
UPDATE for 6/16/2011
Oh, Tony Nik's... you still know how to be the best there is. The Girlfriend and I stopped in last night for a few rounds of yummie libations, and though there were a bunch of people in the place, we still found a quiet table to hang out at. The nice thing about TN's is that, for the most part, the only loud noise - during the week, anyway, from what I have experienced - is from people talking. They have music playing in the background, yes, but this is one of the few places that I have found which doesn't THUMPTHUMPTHUMP you out of the bar with your ears bleeding from the loud music at the end of the night. This place is more for those who actually want to talk to each other... isn't that just cool?! :) 
We love ya, Tony Nik's!
-------------- 

Possibly one of the friendliest and best places I have ever been. Tony Nik's is a cozy, friendly, down to earth, and all around nice place to go to relax on a weekday after work. This is the way a bar should be... good people, great drinks, comfortable to the point where even if you've never been there before, smile and say hi to the bartender and to those around you, and you'll fit in well. The only time I was there and didn't stay for a drink was on a Saturday night... I was with a group of about 8 friends and we stopped in for a drink around 9:30... the place was PACKED. I think there was a private party in the back, and the bar area in front was tight standing room only. We were sad that we couldn't find room to stay and enjoy the place, but no worries... we're going back again soon. Earlier, this time. :)

All in all though, I would recommend this place to anyone... but it's also one of the places where I'd like to keep it to myself as well, because it is such a nice place. ;)
author: Eric P.

description: No complaints here! Bartender nice and attentive. Very cute setup, with plenty of seating in the back. Yummy pomegranate martinis.
author: Amanda V.

description: In a neighborhood besieged by tourists and outsiders you can count on Tony Nik's to have about 80% regulars, good drinks and friendly bartenders.  Favorite place to stop in for a pop on the way home from work or before going out to dinner in the neighborhood.
author: Alex H.

description: Worst Moscow Mule ever. No personality. Dry bartender who can't put even the slightest effort into a mule. Oh, and there's a $20 min for credit cards. Love scam joints like this.
author: Rick S.

description: Very impressed with this bar. We happened to stumble across it while waiting to eat at restaurant nearby. EVERY bartender were SUPER sociable and personable and it really made our trip.  We ended up here every night of our 3-day trip. They pour an EXCELLENT drink, and the vibe is just great. From the lighting to the music, I can't say one bad thing about this place.
author: Rosa C.

description:
+4 for bartenders who're on point and know their whiskeys/bourbons/ryes. Plus their girl-y mixed drinks. Don't hate, just sayin'.

+3 for having a very cool layout and atmosphere - you'll understand once you get there. It's a bar to which you'll look forward to going. Srsly.
author: Mark S. I.

description: Not the 4.5 I thought it would be. $25 min to use a credit card... Oh thanks for mixing my vodka and ginger beer and calling it a mule... Nope, add some lime.. I won't be back. Just not a true 4.5 star.
author: Rich F.

description:
good non-divey spot to grab a drink in north beach

Update

Been here on multiple occasions now

Consistently good drinks.. Cucumber gimlets anyone?
Also, the bartender found out my love for reading and gave me a book. From his own collection. 
It's the little things
author: Sunni B.

description:
This subtle & unassuming bar has a reputation among "my inner beings" for seducing me once I enter. After I get past the no-nonsense bouncer, the bartender always manages to free me of my inhibitions w/ only the magic of his pour.

Transformed, I am then sent out into SF's ambient North Beach, where intelligent hotties are just freely walking up & down the street (FREELY, just available & FREE) like, like, like... 
                                                     (still agape) 
...like Adonis-built co-eds looking for good times. Wait--Many of the guys in NoBe *are* co-eds looking for a good--Nm.

All's I know is that, when the sun comes up, the last thing I usually remember was being at Tony Nik's, so I guess that's a ((good)) thing. ?O_O?
author: Kali K.

description:
Tony Nik's holds a special; place for me. It's the first place i ever went. Back in 1966, on the way home from the hospital, my parents stopped by here to show me off to all their friends. It was a regular stopping place all through my youth and the site of my first legal drink 21 years later. Butch walked (later shuffled) the boards behind the bar for nearly 40 years of my life. The place was where the old school SF sportos would bullshit. He poured a short, stiff drink and could make a pot of coffee last a week.  He was an old school, cash on the bar SF bartender.

I think Butch would like the new Tony Nik's. He'd hate the music and the frou frou drinks and probably wouldn't understand what the hell people were talking about, but he'd like seeing his bar full of happy people having a good time. I feel just as comfortable there as I always have.
author: Chris E.

description:
A hidden gem in North Beach. 

The plan was stop in with my wife for only one drink before dinner. Yeah, that didn't happen. After chatting with one of the nicest bartenders ever, we ended up staying there for over two hours; sipping on martinis and chatting it up with a great crowd. The music was fantastic (soul, chill, funk, rap) and the drinks were extremely good. What made it the best place ever was finding out from the new bartender (yeah we were there that long apparently) that our previous bartender (and new best friend) paid for our first round. 

Highly recommend stopping in for a pre-dinner cocktail.
author: Rick W.

description:
Local watering hole - a mere few blocks from my comfy abode.  As other lovely Yelpers have said, great drinks and really friendly bartenders. David rocks; he listened to me blathering on and on and was just so nice about it (my date didn't seem thrilled, however).  

(Btw, they don't have my fave Scotch - Bruichladdich.  I still love them though.)
author: Kimberly Q.

description: What an amazing bar! Sebastian is an amazing bartender. Serving up unique drinks at great prices. Great atmosphere; cozy but super comfortable. Loved the La Paloma and the Frankfort Sour. Definitely have to check out this place.
author: Alyssa T.

description:
Tony Nik's is a great, chill, classy bar. The bartender there last night was SO nice (I should have gotten his name... oops!)... he humored me while I took forever to pick out a cocktail and then settled on a white russian with blueberry vodka (better with raspberry vodka I learned...). 

My bf took me here after dinner on our first date and we've been back a few times since. The lighting is dim and great and I love the little candle-lit tables. The drinks are not a bargain but they are not outrageously expensive either... They have a full bar, bottled beers, and a few beers on tap (Hefeweizen, Guiness, and 2 others). 

Tony Nik's is great for a date, girls' classy night, to bring parents to, etc. Enjoy!
author: Meghan P.

description: I love the interior, dark moody lighting with red hues and sexy smooth trip hop tunes.
author: Jessabelle R.

description:
Love this joint and the way they love, ok more like DEAL with me and my rambunctious friends.  Always run into a friend or make a fun friend or two here.  

It feels like home.  That is all.
author: Jana S.

description:
A great little bar. I definitely recommend the back area with the couches and tables. 

The bar is nice too but it's a great place to go on the weekday and talk to your friends without worrying about sketchy guys or insanely loud music. 

The drinks are moderately priced which is always great in this city.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Tony Nik's may look like an old man bar from the outside, but the inside is cool and cozy. The bartenders are nice and know how to make good drinks. The bar-goers are a mix of young and old, newbies and loyal customers. 

Tony Nik's is located really a few doors from Tony's the pizza place; a really convenient location when you're on the wait list for dinner. 

Tony Nik's is definitely a gem.
author: NickJess S.

description:
When the Giants won the series, Sebastian the Awesome poured orange shots for the entire bar.

Right?  Right.
author: Pammy C.

description: This bartender named Darren is great.  Get a drink from him!  Awesome mixologist!
author: Brett B.

description: Hell yeah, five stars! Let me tell you why... because Sebastian knows how to make the best Manhattan ever, and his hair is utterly flawless. The douche bag count is usually pretty low and the vibe is always a nice crowd of toasted locals.
author: Jeannine R.

description:
I met up with friends before going out to dinner at this dimly lit, cozy lounge.  

I initially ordered the "Evita" cocktail because I love the combination of lime and ginger beer.  The bartender eyed me warily and poured me half a shot of straight fernet - the primary liquor in "Evita".  After I gagged down the fernet, the helpful bartender laughed and offered to make me a "Dark and Stormy" instead.

I look forward to more pre-dinner drinks at Tony Nik's when I eat out in North Beach.
author: Katie W.

description: This place is very cool ..... its hard to label because it has several layers of vibe going on simultaneously ... kind of intimate,dark,romantic feel to it ..... yet its got an energy to it..... its small so you are going to be near your fellow patrons... its ''old-timey '' but timeless at the same time ... whoever the pampered ,privileged reviewers calling this place '' divey '' are ... they've obviously never set foot in a real dive bar . Really enjoyed this place.... cool place .... will return .
author: Sonny B.

description: Loved this place. Filled with friendly locals. We drank for hours here and talked with the patrons and the bar tender. Super friendly and the drinks were great.
author: Ryan H.

description: Excellent service. Within 15 seconds of sitting down, I had my order taken and the drink was top notch despite minimal direction. Highly recommend for a date with your love, a blind date, or some other shit. This place is fire.
author: Kristopher B.

description:
One of my favorite bars in North Beach.  We always find ourselves stopping by for a pre-dinner cocktail or for a nightcap before heading to bed when we have been out.  

I love the dim lighting, the low-key lounge atmosphere, and the fact that I can usually grab a seat with my friends.  Such a great break from the Maggie McGarrys, etc. that this neighborhood tends to be known for.
author: Meagan C.

description: The lounge is cozy and great for a date. Drinks were well made and the bartender left a lasting impression. Come here while you wait for Tony's pizza next door!
author: Gina H.

description:
Tony Nik's is a favorite hang out for a good friend and I finally met her there on a Friday evening after 9PM.  What a delightful place!   The ambiance is mellow and very conducive to conversation.  The crowd is a nice mix of ages and styles.  And, the bartenders are just awesome!   A college friend I haven't seen in 16 years is a manager and he really enjoys his work.

So, if you're in North Beach, hit Tony Nik's up after your meal!
author: Bill M.

description:
A great bar, which I thought I hadn't been to before. However, I recalled as I walked in that I had in fact, been to Tony Nik's. Only at that time I was rather drunk from pub crawling with my girlfriends during the NB pubcrawl.

Eeks!

But I did remember the bartender as he was super cool and friendly and made great drinks. And being a girl on my own until my guest arrived, I didn't feel weirded out, rather I felt comfortable.

Wednesday night was a good night to go. It was full, but not packed and never was loud to the point where I was shouting to my date.

Small, but a nice feel to it with simple decor and rocking music!!!!

The bathrooms were teeny and reminded me of airplane lavatories, but it may allow you to recreate any mile high club moments ;-)


Definitely will hit this place up again when I am in the neighborhood!
author: Kathy K.

description: I deem it Casanova's bar- sexy and chill. Space is small but the rotation seemed to be about hour-long stays.  Great place to get some strong and intricate cocktails and the bartender was extremely nice and eager to find a good blend based on tastes we like and the liquors we enjoy.  Also very welcoming and not intimidating or snotty if you are a genuine novice looking to expand your pallete :)
author: Shannon T.

description: Kind of a hole in the wall but much cleaner and classier than the outside depicts. Good drinks and prices... Came here on a Friday night and had quick service and a place to sit, can't beat that!  Liked the 70's music playing in the background.
author: Rebecca S.

description:
Tony Nik's is proof positive that North Beach is completely different on the weekends vs. the weekdays. 

On the weekends, the tourists become one with the B&T crowd, the Marina dorks, and everyone else who invades the neighborhood. It's crowded, the good restaurants have lines that are too long, and Golden Boy Pizza even fills up with the yougin' set.

On the weekdays, the regulars come back, drink their Gin and Tonics in a bar that looks new but seems to never have left the 70's, minus a new track or two on the jukebox. The bartenders seem to try to remember the regulars, which is a nightmare for most of the bars in North Beach.

The front of the bar has class -- even the regulars are slightly more formal that most of the other joints in the neighborhood. But it's understated, like a good martini.

The back of the bar is the perfect place to disappear, with it's slightly curved seating area and curtain that hides most of the area. Think dark, with a hint of bad.

It's the perfect little escape if you live here.
author: Patrick N.

description:
A bit of a misnomer this Tony Nik's Cafe...cuz it certainly ain't a cafe.  It's a great little bar in the front, lounge in the back, with a super nice bartender (thanks for being awesome, Sebastian), regular-feel clientele, and really easy, unpretentious vibe.  If it were in my hood I'd be there every night.

Okay, that might be overdoing it.  Not every night.  How about every Monday, Thursday, and Saturday.
author: Tamar D.

description: Great drinks, relaxed atmosphere, friendly bartenders, and a great location.  What's not to like?  This is not a place filled with young, loud, fratty bros, which adds considerably to its appeal.  It's not very big, but its rarely that crowded.  Seating in the back makes for a comfortable evening.
author: Paul W.

description: Excellent. Great place to chill and drink. Left my phone but they took care of me when I returned later even tho I'm pretty sure they were ready to go home. It was closed... Thank you Tony for being authentic and nice to an inebriated tourist.
author: Amy H.

description: The last hit of the bar hopping birthday night. The bartenders there are so cute and SO nice. We didn't know what we wanted as we were already a little buzzed. The bartender made us some awesome cocktails. The crowd is laid back and good looking at times. Def a place I would have never thought to go into while sober as the outside seemed a little hit or miss. But after this experience I'll def come back again!
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Don't come to this place!  I'd like a seat at the bar the next time I go there and would prefer that it's not too crowded.  :)

I'm an uprooted native San Franciscan without a "spot" by design.  I like variety and don't commit to favorites.  I'll admit - this place and its personable bartenders are lovely.  Yes, Sebastian and Devon, you rock!  :)
STRONG drinks if I stray from champagne.  Good Lordie.


Other reviews were ironic.  Old men, cougars,or a young crowd, fancy decor or old school, none of that matters to me if you're with good company.  My cousin and I enjoyed it because there's not a college crowd with pickled kids(no offense Savoys).  Plus, great music is low enough & doesn't compete with your conversation. That's always appreciated.

It's a far classier version of Gino and Carlo's (I lie,  it's nothing like G & C) But it is void of 20-somethings who can't handle their liquor.

:)  here's to being a straight shooter, even though I don't do shots. Cheers anyway
author: Athena S.

description:
This is the definition of a neighborhood bar. Friendly customers and Great customer service.  Every time I go there I'm greeted with a big hello and always end up having a interesting chat with someone. It's just a good vibe.

And it doesn't matter whether it's Sebastian, Devon, Dave, or Darin...you are treated like a local. I've become friends with all of these people - they're just all cool and unique tenders.

And it's so funny when the negative reviews always seem to come from someone who was trying to get a beer at 2, was turned down, and tried someone else. That's why I love this place. They cater to people of all types who are respectful and filter out the rest. Best pub in SF!!!
author: Edward N.

description:
I'm giving this 4 stars, but only because it fits perfectly for it's purpose... not because i'd come here time and time again.

young proffessional? looking for pretty young girls? Enjoy people between the ages of 21-29?  Don't come here.  I describe this as a greaaat old people bar.  The bartenders are chill and laid back, the crowd is very "mature", and the place is small and dingy enough that you keep your expectations low.  I came here with a friend's dad when HE wanted to meet girls;  I'd never come here on the prowl though.

Bring like 2-5 friends if you want a chiller scene with out much distraction... except for drunk older people of course.
author: Joseph F.

description:
Solid and right in the heart of north beach.
Not sure how we ended up here, I just know that we did. 
Funny how bar stories always start out that way, right?
Our group of 20+ crowded this skinny, narrow, functional bar.  Complete with standing bar area, sofas in the back, Dj in the front, this joint was exactly what our rowdy group needed.
 
Tony  Nik's is not a dive.  Clean, decent drinks, friendly staff, and 80's music on Tuesday Night.  Go figure.  Who knew I would bust a move to Michael Jackson, Rick Astley, and Prince.
author: Flor D.

description: This place is nice the bartender is friendly and the anti sphere with the candles on the table give the place a cozy place. The bartender can make a strong dink and you dont test the alcohol in it so watch out but have fun.
author: Donna J.

description:
Pros: nice-shaped small bar.  probably good for mixing and for happy hours

Cons: young male bartenders, douchy clientel,  it's in the confluence of two streets that attract marina striped-shirt assholes, transplant "locals", and B&T weekend warriors.  North Beach sucks: in case you plan to go to this bar and you don't like it, you are surrounded by other bad options.  You'll have to take the bus or a cab or walk to the Geary corridor or to the Financial District or to the hipster Mission bars.  Otherwise you're stuck in North Beach, which is, let's face it, a shadow of it's former self.

Drink elsewhere.
author: Justin C.

description: Love, love, love this place! It's a great, small neighborhood bar where everyone seems to know each other. Drinks are without exception delicious. I usually stick to classic drinks like manhattans, old fashioneds, and sazeracs, but there was that one night I had three dark and stormies, which were also tasty. It's also a good place to go if you want to take someone on a dimly-lit, weeknight date, or if you just want to chill with your friends. Definitely would recommend!
author: Erin V.

description: Atmosphere is wonderful. Drinks are great. The bar tenders are fun and friendly. Owner is a great guy and very friendly. If you haven't visited this place I highly recommend making the trip, you won't be disappointed.
author: Tiffany H.

description: Sabastian is everything a good bartender should be. Great drinks and took pride in his work. Amazing to see.
author: Brian Y.

description:
Actual conversation had by Laura B., Joy M. and two Random Older Mob Types (ROMT) at this fantastic throw back to old school North Beach which I imagine was vastly superior to the current super cheese-ball incarnation.  One of the only reasons I travel to this part of town.  Simply fantastic.:

Seating arrangement is as such:

ROMT #1, ROMT #2, LAURA B., JOY M.

ROMT #2: What are you lovely ladies doing here?

LAURA B: Having a drink.

ROMT #1: What are you ladies having?

We tell them, get a free round, thank them, it's delightful.

ROMT #2 to Laura B.:  nice ring...you engaged?

HE POINTS TO A LARGE FAKE DIAMOND AND FAKE RUBY RING IN THE LIKENESS OF HELLO "MOTHERFUCKING" KITTY THAT WAS PURCHASED IN NYC CHINA TOWN.

Joy M.: YES.  She is engaged to be married.  That is her ring.

Laura B.: What can I say?  He loves me.

And scene.
author: Laura B.

description:
There are very few places that have charm.  This place is one of them. 

80's music, clean, cheap drinks, liars dice, locals, romantic chill booths in the back....who could ask for more? Great place to catch up over get drinks on a weekday.
author: Sandy C.

description: Cool bar and even cooler bartenders. The Dark & Stormy here is great.
author: Scott M.

description: Great old school joint. Very laid back. Decor from the 40's but very clean and well maintained. Relaxing. Awesome and attentive bartender. Location just off of Jackson Square is perfect. Non-touristy. Well done.
author: Ethan W.

description:
If I had a nickel for every drink I've bought at Tony Nik's I could buy some more drinks.  Hmmm. No that really doesn't capture the charm of the place.  On week days, it's about as chill and comfortable an after-work watering hole as a person could want.  The decor is nicer than one expects from an uncrowded neighborhood bar, and the vibe is much nicer than one expects from a bar with such nice decor.  Go - see for yourself, but if you bring all your Marina-Single-Wannabe-Bridge-And-Tunnel-SUV-Driving-Douche-Bag friends, I will have to hunt you down and kill you.

P.S.  The only reason I knocked off one star is that I am almost always just a little bit cold in this place.  Brrrr.
author: Joe C.

description:
Came here after Joey and Eddie's.  I think I have one sentence that can best describe this bar.

A dive bar that is now a lounge because of its professional servers and renovation 7 years ago.  

Will definitely come back.  Service was quick.  Price is reasonable. Very beautiful people here. They even have dice cups here.  Love the old and faded sign outside of the bar but the super modern look inside.
author: jason g.

description:
I ended my first date with a dear old boyfriend here. We enjoyed one last cocktail and shared a sweet first kiss, ten feet from a highly inebriated girl who was taking a time-out with her face smashed against the upholstery of the couch. 

New love? A cozy nap? You can have it all at Tony Nik's.
author: Jill C.

description:
Solid.

As a new to the SF scene and a gal who's still trying to learn about the different neighborhoods, i had pretty much written North Beach off as a tourist trap with Italian food. And while that's true on some levels, there always seems to be a bar that shatters the stereotype and Tony Nik's is it. 

From the moment I walked in, I was treated like a local. The bartendress was rockin with her cute pigtails and friendly smile. The "regulars" at the bar were quick to say hello and offer me a seat as they muddled away at a drink and talked about how much they loved their neighborhood and the bar and everyone you looked at was having a great time.

The surrounds were very retro, which I always love and while I wasn't planning on having hard liquor, well, when you are surrounded by a vibe like that and coming off a long and stressful week, there is no shame in having a martini with three olives on the slightly diiiirty birdy side. And they make a good one here. Actually they made 4 good ones here, but hey, who's counting.






Answer: Your liver, stephy!
author: Stephy S.

description:
A retro chic oasis in the chaos that is North Beach.  It's a great place to get away from the *loose off the goose* titty shirt wearing twits and chodes that flood the area.  The bartenders are very nice and make great drinks as well.

They do have the smallest bathrooms ever though.
author: Luis M.

description: Been here a couple of times.. the first was during the North Beach festival. That was a goddamned nightmare..long and skinny it doesn't take much to get this place crowded..the second time I came it was during the afternoon and that was a lot more enjoyable. One plus is they take CCs..make it a stop, not a destination and be modest with your expectations and you should be fine..
author: Morris D.

description:
One of my flatmates is a big Phoenix Sun's fan... she loves Steve Nash.  She wanted to watch the game at a bar so we decided to head out to Tony Nik's after getting a quick bite to eat.  I can never say 'no' to going to a bar and getting some beer especially with the cool roomies I live with now.  With gelato (scharffen berger and pistachio) on hand, we walked right in -- four seats available right by the bar.  Had a pint of Guinness as I enjoyed my gelato.  The bartender was really cool about us having brought gelato inside the bar, he was friendly, nice and quick.  Before I can even ask him for a glass of water, he was already giving each of of us some.  I was impressed with the service considering he was the only bartender there while more people started rolling in.  

Good crowd (cute men), wonderful service, definitely a great bar!  I can't believe I've waited almost a month before checking out this bar -- it should have been one of my first stops right after I moved in North Beach a month ago.  Will be back here again for sure, perhaps to watch Giants games!

FINAL SCORE:
-  Golden State Warriors (124) vs Phoenix Suns (119);
-  Celeste: 5 pints of beers
*  Yay Warriors ... Andris Biedrins is so cute  *
author: Celeste M.

description:
I'll preface this by saying I've been to Tony Nik's before and had a great time.


Last night, however, proved to be incredibly different.  I went here after spending most of the night at a different bar in North Beach. I was throwing a going away party as I'm moving to a different city this week. The first part of the evening at Tony Nik's was fine. My friends and I found a place to sit in the back and enjoyed our beers.  I went outside with a friend to have a chat and upon coming back in, went up to the bar to order a beer.  I'm standing at the bar, I make eye contact with the male bartender and  we nod at each other. As this is happening, he calls last call.  He then comes over to me and says he just called last call therefore I wouldn't be able to get a drink.  I pleaded with him saying that I was already at the bar when he called it, that we acknowledged eachother and that I think I should be able to get a drink. He was insistent in not serving me so I proceeded to ask the other bartender (or perhaps she was the barback) if she could help me in getting a drink.  He yelled at me that I wasn't allowed to do that.  I then walked away from the bar back to my friends.  

At this point, I was just ready to get out of there when the bartender comes up to me and my friends and starts yelling at me again! Telling me to go look in the mirror (whatever that means?).  Meanwhile, my friends and I are just trying to leave.  We go outside, I'm talking to the bouncer who was incredibly nice and friendly the whole night.  I'm telling him about the customer service of the bartender and how I thought it was inappropriate.  The bartender then follows me outside and starts yelling at me some more!  It was absolutely uncalled for and ridiculous.  I told him I thought he was being incredibly aggressive and that it was inappropriate.  He then proceeded to tell me that he was being "assertive" not aggressive, blah, blah, blah.  

It's too bad that this bartender was such a jerk because I really liked this place and would have recommended it previously to anyone who was curious about a good spot in North Beach.  Not anymore.
author: Hannah F.

description:
Alright, so I studied abroad in Sydney in college.  One of the guys who was in my group of friends while studying there - it turns out he's living in SF for three months while he hangs out with his girlfriend who lives in South SF.  He lives in North Beach, and gives me a call so we can catch up.  

Now, I'm all excited and he suggests Tony Nik's.  Having never heard of it before (living in Duboce Triangle, you don't get up to North Beach that much).  So I get there, small bar, good (read: dark) lighting, only two guys in the whole bar.  Who, of course, are gay - because my Fairy Godmother is looking out for me...I haven't been to a "straight" bar in a long time, so once I do, the blow is softened by encountering some of the gays.  Phew.

So I order a drink, siddle up to the bar, and tell the patrons about who I'm about to meet.  So we're having a great old time.  Then my friend comes in and it's a great time catching up.

Then.  Well, I've considerably eased up since my college days, and I should have known that seeing an Aussie friend from college would be a drinking match waiting to happen.

Fast forward - 6 Vodka-Tonics later...all is good, but then he tries to kiss me, which is no good, no good at all.  Coincidental timing -- right about this time, the bar starts to fill up with people (and its quite small) so I take this as my cue to leave (that is, after the fat man next to me asked me to feel his behind...and oh yes, his date was next to him).  

Got soaking wet waiting for a cab too.  But, I'd definitely go back - the bar was lovely.  Despite the unwanted advances.  I'll give it four stars, because there's no window to climb out of in the bathroom.
author: Leigh c.

description: This place was pack the people inside kinda new each other the drinks were very strong and maybe that why this place was so crowed. I had a fun time just taking with some regular, they were telling me some story about this place the story were very interesting. Good place to have fun.
author: Jeremy D.

description:
