Came here after I attended a roof top party almost right above this bar. I was pretty good to go and probably didn't need anymore drinks. However, we ventured to this bar/lounge and had a blast. It's not that big at all, but it's very modern and stylish inside. The bartenders were fast and courteous. The music was pretty chill and the crowd was great. 

The other day, I took off from work and just went into the city. After cruising around by myself for a bit, I decided to go into this place again and see how it was when I was more sober. It was still great. There were only a few people inside and I ordered just a beer. The bartender was playing music off his iPod and it was groups such as Thievery Corporation, Nightmares on Wax and other chill groups.

I would recommend coming here with a small group of people (like 2-4) to start your night off. There's not too much room and I couldn't imagine it getting too crazy inside.
author: CLINTON W.

description:
The bartenders were both very friendly and the decor is pretty charming but on a Saturday night I found the clientèle to be a little -um, how should i say.....on the "putzy" side.   nothing too offensive really, but everyone appeared to be schmoozing with a client or having drinks with an old law school chum.  (yawn).

I've got a hunch that this place would be a little more bearable on a Monday afternoon.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
I remember the night i got a call from J.S. ...... " Amy, there is a sexy bar is Northbeach ive not noticed before !" ( i have a term 'sexy bar' for anywhere that makes me feel sexy being in it). So one evening walking home from work i took a little peek ..... it have like velvet carpet tiles on the walls .... ooooooooooh! sexy! 

So anyhow, ive been here a couple of times. Once on a 'date', it was pleasant  and second time last night after going to see 'The Bridge'. The bartender is attentive and fun, the music is decent ... rock on the 80's ! and the crowd is very mixed. There are some younger, some older , some locals , some tourists and a cool decor. The Bathroom leaves something to be desired hence this bar only getting 4 stars .. but im glad its in my neighborhood and i will definitely be going back! Rock on Tony's !
author: Amy W.

description: Every time I find myself in North Beach I have to stop by this place. Dave, the bartender, is awesome. Real laid back and friendly guy. They have a great section of scotch, which is my drink. Just a chill place to relax and enjoy the time with friends.
author: David H.

description:
After the rockin' Yelp party, I cabbed it over here to CarOline T.'s annual holiday bash. This is the first year it's been off site (not at her house), but the wine and cheese were still flowing. Well, the wine was, anyway.

I can't say TOO much about Tony Nik's since I went here for a special event, but I had a total blast. Butted heads with my old design professor, and chatted with friends as well as met some new people, too. CarOline didn't have the place totally rented out, so we also got to observe a few other interesting characters. A cool guy who looked like John Lennon, and then one guy who provided a rather unfortunate encounter....
author: Patrick G.

description:
Tony Nik's is a classic San Francisco bar, which has been in business since the 1930's. The owner is actually the grandson of the original owner...how cool is that?
Tony Nik's has a retro feel, they make great drinks, the bartenders are attentive and friendly, and there's always a cool, diverse crowd. If you're looking for a bar in North Beach, this should be your #1 destination.
author: Brianne K.

description: I wrote a review on this bar in 2006 and now writing an update review.  After all these years, this is still my favorite bar in the city.  Sebastian is wonderful. I like to go in on slower nights just to talk with him and the other locals that frequent TonyNiks.
author: Mary S.

description:
A nice hidden gem in often noisy North Beach.  The bartender, Danny, was funny, friendly and easy going, just like the place.  Nothing pretentious.  Nice to meet friends for a casual happy hour.  I hope to go back again.  

And this comes from someone who doesn't frequent bars often.

Bottom's up!
author: Jen L.

description: As I work in the industry  I have never done a Yelp review until today. But I believe the bartenders name is David (a gray haired gentleman , using the term loosely) reminded me of why I didn't stay in Arizona after graduating college. How ever he does have a great head of hair. The space however has a great ambiance but being  industry if one of my guest where to go next, it would not be this place. Dave or David you are building a reputation in the neighborhood  because the pizza place on your block Tony's  where I got a Calzone and told them about my Experince they gave me your name. You are clearly developing a reputation, not sure it one that maximize revenue. Dave this Bud is for you.
author: JL T.

description:
Typical long, narrow lounge.  Very loud.  Sort of hot and stifling.  Trying to be something different with parquet wall tiles and sheer curtains covering nothing.  Not good for groups.

Meh.
author: Jessica M.

description:
Lets paint the scene...

So it's Thursday night and you are looking forward to meeting a new guy at a local bar. Nervous, and practically sweating you stroll to the closest bar between your two North Beach residents. Walk in to this dark bar which is playing a fabulous assortment of 80' music. Grabbed a couple drinks and went to the back booth to chat. We actually had to bartender bring us our drinks to the table so we never had to leave our conversation. 

4 hours, 4 cocktails, and the couple sitting near us completely making out the whole night... priceless. I love this bar.

Lost a star because the bathrooms are tini-tiny.
author: Nancy B.

description:
Ok- I have been in NB for a year now and TNs is still my go-to bar. I have decided to upgrade my rating to 5 stars- because it deserves it - even though my fave bartender did not recognize me on my birthday ;)
I can't deny it is my favorite drinking hole. The new HUGE flat screen TV rocks and if and when I decided to follow any sports - I will be sure to watch all the games there. In the meantime I will continue to frequent TNs with reckless abandon!!!!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
this bar quickly became my neighborhood go-to bar. Nice feel, not a dive, but not too stuffy. You can get a great drink, chat with Sebastian, who is a sweet heart of a bartender and all the while it does not matter if you are in stilettos or a tshirt and jeans. Basically - you can't go wrong.
author: CarOline C.

description: The only "Lounge" in North Beach worth visiting.  Sebastian is a consummate professional, and the clientele are pretty darn classy too.  Recommend!
author: Andrew B.

description:
Ok scratch that.  I think I came on a fluke night.  I've been loving this place lately!


******
Honestly, I really really like Tony Nik's; I think it is a great neighborhood bar.  However, I think people who get into a fight, break a bottle, threaten other people with the broken shards, and knock over a bunch of girls like bowling pins should not be allowed to stay in the bar and continue drinking.  Last time I checked, North Beach seems to be the land of bouncers and cover charges. This particular bouncer/doorman was standing watching this whole event and didn't do anything about it.  He didn't even kick the people out.  Just goes to show you, if something goes wrong here you're on your own!
author: Kerry D.

description: Never a bad time at Tony Nik's!  Great drinks, fun peeps, awesome bartender.  Frankbastian (aka Sebastian) does up your drinks right!  Don't hang in North Beach much, but when I do, this is a must-stop.
author: D. S.

description: This is a great hidden gem in North Beach if you are going out and about for a good night in North Beach. The bartenders are very talented and mix up some of the best and potent drinks you can find...
author: Jim B.

description:
Great bar - has the absolute feel of a good 'ole neighborhood joint.  Met up with a friend for a few martinis - why is it that you can't ever stop with 1 martini??  Oh wait, maybe that's just me ... Never mind!

Super friendly bartender.  How can I not be completely enamored with a bar in which the bartender thought me to be 26 ... Love. Love. Love.

North Beach can be disastrous to find parking pretty much any time of day - any day of the week.  Thankfully, the restaurant next door has valet and they are more than happy to take your $10 to valet your car.  How happy was I that when the valet was ready to close, one of the guys parked my car on the street for me and came into the bar and brought me my keys.  

Fabulous!

P.S. They serve Hangar One ... Woop Woop!
author: Nicole Rynee B.

description: Had the best first date of my life here!!! I'm new to SF and love bars that exude good energy that one is incapable of explaining with words why it's sooo good. I'll do my best to recollect. Solid drinks (pun intended), good lighting, great energy= best bar in NB! You can chill at the bar and talk it up with the cool tenders or sit intimately in the back. Thanks Tony Nik's!!!
author: Gina H.

description:
Good bar. North Beach Bridge and Tunnel meatheads tend to miss this when they're trawling for tuna, so they crowd is more 'neighborhood' than 'tourist,' which is extremely rare for NB. The decor is 'lived in' while remaining 'stylish' - also a rare treat for a bar in North Beach. The bartenders are pros and I'm an alcoholic, so it's a match made in heaven.

Now that I think about it, this place sucks and you'll hate it. Whatever you do, don't drink here.
author: West R.

description:
I have to give this place 5 stars for the bartender, Sebastian, and for the scene itself.  The Texans who we ran into Friday night were more of a 1.5...

My boyfriend and I had just enjoyed a lovely Persian dinner down the street by Grant and Green.  We decided to stroll into TN's before going home and  we sat ourselves at the corner of the bar by an aggressive hippie who kept telling my BF to give him more space.  

After a drink in, we were startled to hear the bartender barrate a trashed Texan (aged 50 years).  Apparently she had been "cut off" and so retaliated by taking sips out of every drink the bartender placed on the counter.  I have absolutely no clue why she was not thrown out.  Suffice it to say, things began to worsen.  

About a drink later my beau jumped about a foot into the air.

Apparently the drunk skank had been goaded by a fellow Texan to stick her tongue in his ear.  We chose to ignore this outburst, as it was this 50-yr-olds first time in SF, but I told my beau that if i saw her do it again there would be trouble.  

Sure enough, about 20 minutes later I peripherally noticed her going in for the kill.  Without even giving it a thought, I grabbed the beau's full Dewar's and soda, and with a well-timed flick of the wrist, flung it in the skank's face.  

She began wailing "Oh my Gawd! oh my Gawd!"  Her friend beckoned her to the other end of the bar and cleaned her up, but this hot mess stayed on, wet hair and all, probably until well after we had left.
author: Hannah A.

description: My friends and I  love watching Sat/Sun games at this spot because the atmosphere is always so absolute cool... Although I ended up doing the 'exact' opposite of what I'd planned for the day, I had one of the most enjoyable Super Bowl viewings I can remember watching the game at T-Nik's.  I sincerely LOVE  this place and the people that work and reside here for so many many reasons.  Now there's one more! Tony Nik's is simply the Best of the Best...!
author: Cordane C.

description:
Tony Niks is by far my favorite cocktail den in North Beach. The bar is a throwback to an older more refined era. Most unusually this is manifested in the pure cleanliness of the place. A cleanliness most often reserved for high end hotel bars. The exterior is non-discript, the only noticeable feature being the small wall of glass bricks. Upon entering the small house of spirits you are greeted with a medium length bar on your left with a small area in the very front holding a 2 person table between the window and the curve of the bar. The table and bar comprise a full half of the space. The remaining half holds two diminutive bathrooms and a dark but comfortable lounge area. The back half is partially separated by a curved wall of glass bricks mirroring the front. The bathrooms are just large enough to house the commode and a very tiny sink. really all you need and an efficient use of space. The lounge area comprises of a few tables and very well appointed benches and chairs. Candle light is the principle source for this lounge area. 

   Tony Nik's is run by the grandson of the original owner. The grandson takes pride in keeping it as close to original as possible and running it with the same care and ideals as similar gin joints of the era. That said, it is the cocktails and the bartenders that are on point here, complimented by a clean and sophisticated space. Come here for classic cocktails and superior service. Tony Nik's will not be a house that involves intensive modern pretentious mixology utilizing the herbs, spices and other odd ingredients that bartenders scavenged from the kitchen thinking they are a beverage chef. 

   The original drinking dens are going the way of the beautiful old movies houses that once use to liberally populate the city. The Castro is the only movie house that remains, Tony Nik's may be the only quality vintage elixir purveyor to grace our fine city.
author: Christopher N.

description:
Tony Nik's is a great, classy, cozy, little spot to have a drink on a Sunday evening with mixed company.

If you're looking for "a scene", this is not the place. 

You go here to have well-made drinks, chat with the bartender, or have a conversation with a buddy or your date. 

If I lived in the 'hood, I would probably be a regular.
author: John Eric S.

description:
I LOVE TONY NIK'S!!!

Sebastian is THE MAN and this places rocks all around. North Beach is a great neighborhood and this is the best bar!

P.S. Sebastian makes the best Sidecars.
author: Ali C.

description:
A cool neighborhood joint.  The place actually is a little bigger than it looks, there is a small "lounge" area all the way in the back that can be a cool spot to hang out with a bunch of friends.

This was our final stop on Fleet Week, the last bar we stopped by to buy sailors drinks.  We walked in and said hi to sailors (it's easy to spot as they are in their uniforms), offered to buy them a drink.  While waiting, we shook their hands, thanked them and asked them where they are from...it felt awesome having an opportunity to thank our servicemen.  Every single sailor we met that night was beyond appreciative of our simple gesture of buying them a drink.  Most just wanted a Bud Light, a few got something hard and quite a few declined (they said they had enough already but thanked me profusely nonetheless).  

There was only one bartender working and he was beyond busy but he was quick and very friendly.  I'm not sure what and how much we ordered but the tab only came to $60 so I'm guessing the price is pretty reasonable here.  

There were a few regulars, one of them thanked me for buying the sailors drinks and so I bought him a drink too!  Not sure what he ordered but he said I should try - it was licorice like, interesting.  Another couple thanked me too and said more people should be like me - appreciating and thanking our servicemen, AMEN to that!  

It was a blast and I salute all servicemen!
author: Gloria H.

description:
I'm kind of embarrassed that I have only been here once, and live 2 blocks down the street. Well, all that is going to change. Tony Nik's has a nice vibe to it and some comfortable seating. The staff is extremely friendly as well. The Dirty Martini that Sebastian made was pretty damn good...

Update: The go to bar of choice in NB. I took my mom here and she had a good time, so what else can you say...
author: Nicolas H.

description:
This is a great place to get a drink on a weeknight when you want to actually hear your companions.

Kudos to the bartender!  It's been awhile since someone made a  Maker's Mark Manhattan, over, the correct way (shaken a couple of times in a cocktail shaker and not stirred in the glass with a straws).

Tip well!
author: Andrew M.

description: Stopped in here on a Sunday during the North Beach festival. The place was obviously packed but they actually provided some good and fast service, so we were able to get some drinks without having to wait too long. Just a typical neighborhood joint though and pretty small, but I'm sure i'll stop in again the next time i'm in the area.
author: Anthony L.

description: My favorite dive in North Beach.  I don't want to admit how long I've been coming to this bar, but its just one of those great neighborhood spots that makes north beach north beach.  Please keep Tony Nik's around another 50 years.
author: Roberta W.

description: This place is super cute.  The front looks somewhat art-deco, but the interior brings a cozy and friendly feeling to this place.  The bartender's are friendly and the patrons approachable.  Love the different selection  specialty cocktails! I shall return!
author: Matt P.

description: This is a great place to have a few drinks while waiting for tables at surrounding restaurants. I had a great time here with my wife, the drinks were cold and the prices were fair.
author: Joel H.

description:
This is where I take friends from other parts of the city in North Beach to prove to that North Beach is a fun 'hood with great places to go out, drink and meet cool people.  

Great ambience, great drinks, great people.

Loves it!
author: Derek B.

description:
Sweet neighborhood bar.   I wish I lived in this neighborhood just so I could have a martini here every night.  But I don't.  Which is probably good.  So I have to make do finding excuses to be in North Beach.  

But yes, great martinis.  Great mixed drinks.  Great vibe.   And great bartenders.   A solid spot if you are around.
author: Blake W.

description:
Drinks are expensive, and there's an implicit dress code, but it's not as pretentious as you might think when you first enter. Pretty friendly, and definitely a laid back lounge vibe. But there's not much room to lounge in... the place is packed like a hallway. Overall, mediocre. 

You probably won't get in under 21.
author: Chris L.

description: This is a terrific place to get a drink. Good drinks, good service, decent place to sit. A little small, so don't come with a large group.
author: Guillermo K.

description: A cool place to stop by for a drink, but it's really small so I can't imagine coming here to party at night.
author: Andrew M.

description:
So we went to hear Pink Martini and there was this d-thirty somethin stripped shirt guy all excited about hearing the band and sitting on the edge of his seat and the h-fifty somfin mama poked him and said sit back cuz she couldn't see the band and the strippee guy got all pissed and then the thirty couple and the fifty couple were gonna duke it out and then I almost laughed when the stripped shirt says "HEY, I'm Italian (jes rude Americano), don't tell me what to do" and then fifty mama says "I'm Italian too so don't tell ME what to do, call the police".

Damn...whyz da stripped shirt getting all bunchy crunchy undyboxer fer? Cuz he's got hemmoroids or somethin?

Anyway, we skeedadled out of that place just needing to watch more Americano Italian martini action at Tony Nik's....less fisticuffs with some older gay men at the bar. Parking is always the challenge, but the vibe at Tony Nik's was right for laughing about stripped shirt guy.
author: miriam b.

description: The Nik deserves 5 stars specifically for its collection of locals, old and young, who pretty much just want to relax and have some damn drinks.
author: W. S.

description: It's funny because this place has a super ghetto sign that looks like it got battered by a hurricane but the inside is quite nice. First cafe I have been to in which neither food nor coffee are its core competency. Pretty small bar with a few tables in the back to sit around. Compared to the other North Beach bars, this place is clean-cut, organized, and more contemporary which makes it a nice stop in between the traditional pubs with all the filth and ruckus.
author: Ed L.

description: My favorite bar in the city for after dinner cocktails.  Old school.  Great service.  Sebastian is a pro
author: Julie R.

description:
Whenever I'm sitting at home on a weeknight, craving a well mixed cocktail and place for conversation where the music isn't blowing out my eardrums, I head here.  I can't really say about the weekends though, as we usually high tail it out of the neighborhood.  

Oh, and Tuesday nights seem to be a special kind of magic.  Probably because the beautiful and talented Windee is spinning and the crowd she brings in is usually a great mix.   

Oh yeah, and they have Bulleit Bourbon now.  Even better!
author: Jessica B.

description: I think I may enjoy this bar if I were a male in my mid-to-late thirties. Mood lighting does not reflect the clientele. Not recommended for those born after 1978.
author: Ashley M.

description: Great atmosphere and bartenders. Cocktails are solid, but nothing special.
author: Heidi K.

description: A bit off the main weekend madness path with an unassuming entrance makes this spot have a more chill vibe that many other bars in the area, even when packed on a Saturday.  Bartender had good skills, style and friendly attitude.  Nice cushy bench seating at some of the tables.  Good music playing that my party all enjoyed.
author: Marc S.

description:
A great find in North Beach.  No B&T crowd at all.  The decor is sophisticated and cosy, and the bartenders are affable.  This is where you go for a well-made martini, not a drink made in a blender or that tastes like an alcohol-laced smoothie.  They make a mean Maker's Manhattan.

As a caveat emptor moment - I cannot seem to leave this bar without being over-served.  Can bartenders really be too attentive?
author: darla s.

description:
This is another place that I cannot believe I haven't written a review of.  I was here last night, and after realizing how long it had been since my last visit, I remembered why I like Tony Nik's so much:

- on weeknights, there is always a place to sit (weekends can be crowded, but that's okay)
- you can actually hear your companions talking
- the bartenders are super friendly and nice
- a lot of the patron's are locals and not skeezy like at some other NB places
- the atmosphere of the place gives off a good vibe

I really feel like this place is great for all sorts of occasions, whether it's a drink with coworkers, a place to take a date, or whatever.  I've been here for all sorts of reasons (including New Years a few years ago, as well as a Halloween party) and I always have a fantastic time.
author: Lindsay B.

description: Don't let the name fool you although not a Cafe a very nice throw back look and feel for a bar with lounge in the back for a small party or just some alone time with someone. Nice battening and well made drinks good mixture of locals and tourist with a great selection of music. Although a little small once the evening night life starts it can be a bit crowded. overall great place to sit back and relax with a great environment. Will definitely be there again
author: Scottie M.

description:
Nice...something off the beaten path.

Tiny and dark, you can actually hold a conversation with someone here, maybe even some older gent you just met (if that's what you're into), and the drinks are tasty.

P.S.  Can't go wrong with that!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Very cool place.  Hip decor, but crowd is not over hip.  You know - it is still a chill place to hang and have a conversation with friends.  People watching/laughing is still good though! (And being watched is also good fun!)  Oh, and the fact that the music selection this evening was serious 80's flashback; which is all good!  As the bartender said, the music makes him (and us!!!) still feel cool!

Great drinks!  First round before dinner included a lovely dirty martini.  After dinner round was bubbly.  Generally I am very hesitant to order wine, let alone sparkling wine at a "bar."  These folks gots it going on though -- choice between Mumm Brut and Perrier Jouet Brut.  Ok, as if there is a choice???  (PJ, btw!)
author: Danielle R.

description:
Great place - great drinks, love the "back " section with the tables.
Now, that said, it is TINY and the bathrooms are tinier.  Yes, smaller than an airplane bathroom, it's true, but really, how long do you spend inside the bathroom?
author: K L.

description: This is my favorite bar in North Beach. It has a nice bar area and bench seating in the back. It's dark, but not dingy with a retro feel.  The bartenders are nice, not pretentious. Specials are written on the mirror and there's a good chance one will suit any taste. Prices are good for this area.
author: Jody B.

description: One of SF's gems! Not only are the cocktails fabulous but Sebastian is also a fantastic bartender! Have been coming here for years and plan on continuing to do so!
author: Dahlia S.

description:
The only reason i'm not 5-ing this is because I'm not a fan of hard alcohol, and this is supposed to be the best place to get a mixed drink in NB. On any given sunny day it will have at least very well-dressed gentlemen slowly sipping large martini's. Any time of day, despite any festival, holiday, or nice weather.

Returned a few times recently- oh such a bar rat- and had a stellar time. The conversation doesn't start with "Where are you from?" but, more segues into whether it's Russian or Telegraph Hill. Amazing cosmos.
author: Anna B.

description: Tony Niks is a gem. Old North Beach Dive Bar.. but what a delight to walk in, great feel.. its a BAR, no gimmicks, great bartender on a Saturday afternoon, filed up quickly with a FAB vib.. Thank you for keeping this North Beach Bar alive.. definitely will be on my radar for the next crawl thru North Beach.  Ciao
author: DC C.

description: AWESOME TENTH ANNIVERSARY party Saturday.  One of the best nights I have ever had in SF and I am a native.  Mark and friends could not have done a better job.........I had two cousins in town, one from Manhattan, one from country town Oregon, and we all loved it.  THANKS and MILLE GRAZIE for your hospitality and antipasti!!!
author: Michael G.

description:
Alrighty.  This is funny because I know Sebastian actually reads these.

Why I like this place:  It's right around the corner from my house, I know all the bartenders, the booze is cheap and the people are nice.  Sounds like the theme song of Cheers, doesn't it?

It's a lot more laid back than most places and the odd patterned wall will make you feel psychedelic after a while.  But it's all good and eventually you'll get stuck staring at their huge TV.  It truly is a massive TV - go look at it tell me that is not a big TV to have hang off a wall like that.

Anyway, I come here when I'm feeling spunky and I swear the people that work there have got to be saints to put up with me when I'm on one of my hyper rampages.  :o)
author: Susan C.

description: My favorite bar in North Beach and I have been coming for years.  It is everything that a neighborhood bar should be---1)  friendly bartenders (sebastian and darren)  2) affordable prices  3) chill atmosphere without it been pretentious or rundown  4) neighborhood crowd  5) great drinks.  This is an adult bar, where people come to hang out with friends, or just random people at the bar.  The best thing about Tony Nik's is that it is not trying hard to be anything pretentious or flashy, or hip....just a normal bar, with normal cool people
author: Sameer D.

description: Fun bar/ lounge with strong drinks and friendly bartenders. What more could anyone want for a rowdy birthday celebration? :-)
author: Lisa C.

description: The bartenders are amazing and generous, the ambiance is lovely, DJ is always rockin it.  Every time I come here, I have a great time. There is plenty of standing room, bar space, and a sitting area in the back. The decor is beautiful. I really just love everything here!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
fun neighborhood bar.

somehow i always end up here after dining in the area.  and it's usually after having a few already...so much so that i'd always forget what bar it was the next day.  

so this last time,  the bartenders tucked a napkin with their logo on it into my purse.  

i was quite thankful since i was missing my amex card the next day.

lo and behold, the napkin was my saving grace and i was quickly on the phone and chatting with one of the friendly bartenders.  apparently this happens often as they had 6 other forgotten cards on hand.

you can find straight up classic drinks but no real fancy mixology here.  overall, it's a nice and unpretentious bar to chill and relax at the counter or at the smaller seated tables in the back.

cheers!
author: Anh V.

description:
This place had a much better atmosphere when it was more of a  neighborhood bar.  Gotten really crowded as of late.  I know it's not a really a bad thing.  

Quick tips, go straight to the back of the bar and grab one of the tables or try to grab the nook up front.   You can usually find one open.   The staff has always been friendly and professional.
author: John C.

description:
Tony Nik's is the Place!

If you live in "The hood!" This place is Booming with mostly locals! Don't hold it against them if the "riif raff " from Broadway stumbles in!!  You can always count on a friendly bartender~ And a good cocktail!  Devon makes the best margarita's! I always bring my friends from different neighborhoods into Tony's... And they always love it!!!
author: christina h.

description:
This place is always fun.  Such an assortment of people that pass in and out, and pass out, at the Tony Nik's.

Last night saw a pretty good look-a-like for Vince Vaughn. And 6'4" no less.  He was hanging out with his friend who happened to look like Russell Crowe.  Some nights my sport becomes pointing at people and blurting out their celebrity likeness.  

After entertaining ourselves on drinks and the mixture of ROMTs (Thanks Laura B for the great acronym) and Irish lads, we headed out the doors only to see Vince Vaughn smoking (so true to character).  

me:  Good night Vince!
Vince: What about Russell?
me: Good night Russell - loved you in "The Gladiator."
author: Kimberly D.

description: I have always loved this bar - my favorite in NB.  Have come here many times, most recently during the NB festival.  Given the lay out, it is very difficult to get in and out of when the crowds are out like during festivals, or Halloween, or St.Patty's, etc.  It can also get really hot.  But, the drinks are good, the staff is always nice, and I always like the music they play.  The crowd is generally older than the typical NB bar, which I appreciate.
author: N F.

description: Awesome customer service...good bartender...good drinks...and awesome little atmosphere with nice classical music...tv for sports...crowds of all types. Fun place
author: Chris M.

description: Great spot to have a few drinks, and hang out with a few close friends. The size is just perfect for an intimate meeting, or a nice mellow function. Overall One of the best bar's I have been too. Would recommend to all people visiting San Francisco.
author: Roger I.

description: Might be my favorite bar in the city. Good music and usually not too packed. Great bartenders and in my opinion the best martini in SF. Watch out for cougars!
author: Bryan S.

description:
if i were a dude, looking to find some clueless girls, this would be a four-star joint for me. if i were a girl, out with a few friends, i'd be scared of the same guys swarming and annoying us. if i were me, i'd find both of those types hilarious and just want to enjoy a beer or two on the back sofa, which i did tonight.

this place is alright. i can sum it up in one, small sentence: "it's north beach." expect cocky meatheads and smarmy princesses to abound.
author: Jeremiah W.

description: Best damn bar in North Beach, possibly north of Market street! No shit! Brought some out-of-towner friends here and they LOVED it! Such a great spot!
author: Shannon R.

description: So I went into Tony Nik's to grab a drink while I waited for Nua to open. Bartender was not the friendliest, but she poured a stiff cocktail. Place was pretty empty at this time of day, except for what looked like some regulars. Next time I am in this neighborhood, I would probably stop back by to check it out.
author: Lisa A.

description: I live in the neighborhood and this is the local's spot. Go there a few times and the bartenders will make a point of knowing your name. This is what a bar should be.. service, stiff drinks and ambiance. This is the  best bar in North Beach.... that does not have necade ladies.
author: Chris N.

description: Stopped by last week for a lil' private party here. Nothing out of the ordinary other than being a known local dive. Nice and warm from the wet weather, I enjoyed a couple of their signature cosmos over in the back couches. Though a bit narrow, there's not much room for parties of 20 and more.
author: Leroid D.

description: Terrific neighborhood NB bar, with some cozy seating in back if you can get it. When I walked in last night, I defintely felt that I was not a regular, and I like that!
author: Nish N.

description: A grown-up bar in a neighborhood full of teenagers.
author: Megan W.

description: You took me here once, long ago.  We were fighting, as usual.  Your golden hair was tied up in pigtails; God you are so beautiful, even in memory.  We drank Irish coffee as the fog rolled in and the chill night swept through the city.  Dark, cream-colored lights lit up another couple, an Asian man and a tall, aging red-head, sitting at the couches in the back.  The gruff Italian bartender kept away, wiping down tumblers just out of earshot, but always kept one unobtrusive eye on our drinks.  We talked, and talked, and leaned closer and closer, and your heart melted a little bit into mine, like it used to.  When we left, we were arm-in-arm again.  You told me that you still loved me, but that it was hard, maybe too hard, and I knew it was true.  I kissed you goodnight in front of your apartment, one of the last kisses we ever had.  I miss you, every day.
author: Mason G.

description: I first went to this place on my birthday in Sept 06 - didn't write a review, don't know why.  This place has now left an impression on me.  I've been there the past two nights.  The first night I was there because a man in my neighborhood found my iPod and went through hoops and ladders to find me, eventually calling Apple Care Customer Service.  He's a local in North Beach, so am I, and we sat at Tony Nik's while he explained to me just what all those hoops and ladders he went through entailed.  The bartender knew him, and I felt comfortable there.  Last night I went there later at night and hung out for a couple hours.  The crowd gets a little younger as the night moves on, and, unlike many bars in my neighborhood, this one is actually packed with people that live in the neighborhood.  It was really nice, and I appreciate places like this more and more.
author: Lindsay T.

description: The bartender charged me twice for the same drink. I protested. He was first insistent, and then rude. I coughed up, and then spilled my 10 dollar guinness all over myself when I tried to drink it. It's hard to drink beer when your jaw is on the floor.
author: bristol b.

description: What a cool bar, it's a shame so many people know about it. If I were omnipotent, I would have this place permanently set with about half a dozen people in it. But I'm not, and it's still really cool, small and cozy with really nice staff, even when I begin slurring my words. We were up here for a friends birthday party and had a great time hanging out and it wasn't so loud that we couldn't talk. You never find that. I can't say anything else that everyone hasn't already said. Good bar with good drinks and good people.
author: Michael E.

description: This is a cool neighborhood bar.  I went for a birthday and my friend rented out the back area.  There is very little room to move therefore dancing is out of the question here.  Besides you don't want me to dance.  I will cause an earthquake.  The bartender was really nice.  He probably the owner.  I will definitely go back just to chill.
author: Fatty A.

description: Tony, Nick, Danny, Mark, Chad and Biff... wow, when I arrived at 10:00 pm on Sat night the place was a total sausage fest.  I came for drinks with the bf so I wasn't trying to check out the talent or competition, but apart from the waitress I was the only female in there.  My bf also took the time, as only he could,  to comment on the unusual lack of "gash" in the bar. However, in another hour or so the ratios were fairly even.  I loved the bar: laid-back, friendly service, good lighting and fun cushy seats in the back.  BYOB (bring your own babe) for an even better time.
author: Justy L.

description: My favorite neighborhood bar.  Always a great vibe, good martinis and a good crowd.  It is rarely to loud or crazy.  And the bartenders are very friendly.  Although I sometimes wish it weren't so damned convenient...
author: Erica G.

description: One of my stand-by spots for a friendly watering hole in my neighborhood.  The clientele is friendly, the vibe is mellow and non-touristy, and the bartenders are really cool (especially Devon!).
author: Lynn S.

description: My friends and I decided to get a drink in North Beach before seeing a comedy show at Cobb's.  We wandered a block or so from Washington Square and found this little dive.  It was empty and so we took seats at the bar and had a short conversation with the bartender there.  It's small in there, but it felt nice and neighborhoody unlike a lot of the NB lounge bars.  Ya gotta love stiff drinks and cool barmen.
author: angela k.

description: Great little bar for locals in a sea of tourist kitsch.  Fun bar staff too.  I would give it 5 stars, but they somehow lost my debit card.
author: Kurt L.

description:
nice pours, bachelor pad decor, doting service.  great place to stop for a couple of drinks before or after whatever else it is that you do.

say hi to Seb por moi.

.n.
author: Nathan G.

description: Best bartenders in SF are here.  They also serve ice cold High Life.  TN's is great if you're looking for a chill scene - people don't come here from the East Bay to fight or get hyphy like they do on Grant Street.
author: Raja B.

description: I agree that this is a place for a weekday, because it is tiny and I would hate to try to get around in there if it was packed. In the back of the bar, there is a curved bench, with a few little round tables, and soft dim lighting on the dark wood paneling. It would have felt like a nice cozy place to drink a vodka and soda and chat, but for the fact that they were blasting bad 90's rock. I HATE the Goo Goo Dolls, as anyone that knows me can attest. After a bunch of Gin Blossoms, Third Eye Blind and the like, we had to get out of there. It could be a classy understated place, but playing music that loud changed the atmosphere. This isn't a bar to bring a date and talk. Even on Wedneday, the bar was pretty full by 10. It seemed like a nice mix of Marina/North Beach/Financial regular people, nothing too crazy. The crazy part was that there was a couple there, and man and a woman, that were the tallest people I've ever seen. I know women over 6' and this lady was well over 6'4. And she was wearing flats. Her date was even taller. I tried not to stare, but they were attractive as well.
author: Merrilee T.

description: Woo hoo! The heavy-handed and entertainingly surly 'tender was drunk, and after 3 sips of my cocktail, so was I!
author: Beverage Appreciato R.

description: Tony Nik's has become my destination when in North Beach. Beginning with the locals' faces and hugs, the moment you walk into this classy bar with warm hues and comfortably snug seating, you will feel beautiful amongst beautiful people. I wouldn't be regarded as a martini drinker, but I've found myself asking for a 'dirty martini, two olives' a number of times. Why you ask? Who knows. But the nook brings it out of me. Seriously, if  you want a sip of insider NB, then dare to venture inside the bar.
author: Maureen S.

description: Not only did I love the vibe of this place (void of cheesiness, which is a plus in northbeach; chic yet unpretentious) i also got a kick out of the intense and flirty woman with the crocodile purse who, i think, was hitting on me... but when i asked her what she did for a living, she gazed at me soulfully and said "i am a mathematics editor". what? wow, i think thats my favorite pick-up line this week!
author: jenna p.

description: When you're friend is obsessed with the Godfather trilogy to the point where he randomly blurts 'fuggedaboutit' at any given time and then theme's his birthday party 'The Godfather II' (yes II), Tony Nik's is the place to be. We had a huge group and the service was excellent even as the place got crowded. eclectic mix of people as the night went on, but the drinks flowed. recommend if you happen to be in north beach and don't want to run into any d-bags as this placed seemed pleasantly d-bag free.
author: Gabe b.

description: Yup, I agree. Really love this place (although weekends are a little crowded.)  Only problem is when we go we drink too much, get hungry and go next door to Mangarosa and spend way too much money.  Plus they have Sailor Jerry rum. Mmmmm.
author: Michael G.

description: Was five stars until some of the clientele began texting, emailing and cell-phoning each other while avoiding eye-contact at the bar.  A subtile hint might be putting an old cellphone in a drink glass with water in it behind the bar as a subtile hint to discourage the annoying misuse of technology and restore conviviality in what was once a retro 1930's classic.
author: Dave H.

description: Love this bar.  This is a place you go on a Tuesday night with a couple of friends to catch up with.  It's a tiny little retro lounge and is definitely a hidden gem in North Beach.
author: Tanger T.

description: North Beach has a lot of bars.  and a lot of them are full of unsavory drunks (well, they are bars afterall)....but Tony Niks is what i'd call the perfect blend of neighborhood bar and chic sophisticated bar.  it's small, quaint, romantically lit. you can sit at the bar or a couple of small tables in the back.  the bartenders are old-school cool.  they even made up the ooma-tini for me!  it's my favorite bar in north beach.
author: Kate F.

description: Perfect starter or last-call spot for the weekend or a great weekday chill venue. Just don't let your friend give the bartender your number; he might call it 26 times... that same night.
author: Gretchen T.

description: Started going here years ago. Came across it while walking around North Beach trying to find something to do. Very small and narrow bar but so cute! The bartenders are always very nice and accomodating. The crowd is much older during the day and fairly young and hip in the evening. Great place for a first date, since there are a few tables in the back. This is a place that you have to go to if you live in San Francisco, it's been around forever.
author: Heather L.

description: I'm on a roll with all these great dive bar reviews... perhaps my standards have been compromised?  All-in-all Tony Nik's is probably one of the best followup ideas to a night of standup at Cobb's that I've experienced.  Walking in to TN's was what I remembered the bar area of the Regal Beagle to be like- down to Larry sitting at the bar scamming on chicks.  It's a skinny squeeze past the bar to the little lounge area and the bathroom.  Agree with Lou Eaaaasy with the tiny bathroom.  I dunno, maybe he went to the ladies' restroom too.  Not at the same time as me of course unless I didn't see him but who can hide anything in that little broomcloset?  I digress.  Retro 70's wooden veneer paneled walls, red vinyl stools and tacky, brassy wall decorations.  No gold-veined mirrors in the bathroom though :).  Bartender was on his toes and the bouncer was friendly.
author: Marjorie B.

description: Awesome NB neighborhood bar.  I love this place. Its got great retro style, cool non-touristy neighborhood people and a place you can always go and hang if you want a cocktail.  It gets a bit crowded on weekends due to its small size, but I love to hit this place on the weekdays.
author: Anna S.

description: Chill, good crowd, just dark enough, cozy tables in back, great bartenders, straightforward drinks....  Gotta love Tony Nik's.
author: Hayley W.

description: In my top 5 SF bars.  Perfect martinis, fun ambiance, talkative (but not too talkative) bartenders with great knowledge of the city.  Two different bartenders have given me excellent dinner ideas.  I can't put into words how great this place is.  It is just something to experience.
author: Marla L.

description: Great spot for an early drink - something I'm getting into these days.  The noon-to-9 bartender made us a nice, tight Hendricks martini and had some great, lazy afternoon drinking music on his iPod hooked up to the bar speakers.  This is such a great, old bar in a fun and lowkey SF neighborhood.
author: Anne M.

description: I love this place!!!!!  I need to stop back in sometime soon.  One of the only non cheesy/ ba nd T places in North Beach.
author: Tracy M.

description: Great drinks and a good place to go for happy hour.  Not a huge 20-something crowd, but the bartenders make great drinks.   Sit in the back if you can!
author: Elizabeth R.

description: Not the best place to go meet people, but a pretty nice place to have a drink on a weekday night, have weekend glass of scotch or strong manhattan, or just stop off between neighborhood bars.  The decor is awesome and you will usually only find SF locals if you like that sort of thing (i do)
author: D S.

description: A couple years ago, Erica G. and Blake W. ushered me into the wonderful world of martinis at this bar, with grand promises of Casablanca-like coolness, the eradication of hangovers, and smooth cold deliciousness.  Had they done so anywhere else, they might not have managed to hook me, but that night, they made a believer out of me (and I think were also the impetus for me dying my hair dark brown on a dare, but that part's a bit fuzzy).  I've come back many a time since then, and whether it's for the martinis or a beer, it's still one of the best low-key spots around.
author: S T.

description: Can't say enough good things about this place! Tuesday nights rock...with a woman dj spinning some awesome classics, the ambiance is nothing short than perfect. Sebastian is a kick ass bartender and wouldn't trade him in for the world. My new local place to grab a great drink, you can chill at the tables or at the bar and still feel like you are experiencing something magical.
author: Stephanie J.

description: great local bar in north beach. it's quaint and the drinks are stiff. It's a great place to duck into before dinner or afterwards for night cap. It get's packed here during North Beach Festival. It has a good crowd too.
author: jen v.

description: My favorite North Beach bar. Especially for a cheap, friendly post-work drink on a weekday. Great service, friendly crowd, a few tables sprinkled here and there. Just a small little laid-back locals place.
author: Tim B.

description: Great Neighborhood bar.  Laid back vibe, not at all pretentious, but not it doesn't have the tough guy, greaseball contingent that some other bars in North Beach have.
author: Christian W.

description: Awesome little neighborhoody bar in a hood I don't live in. Yet, I have managed to spend many a drunken evening and Tony Nik's. Cheers!
author: Diana W.

description: A very cool neighborhood bar.  Stiff drinks.  Friendly staff.  And tolerant of my antics.  If this bar was a woman, she'd be the cool but not so cute friend of the girl you want.
author: A H.

description: This one of my local spots in my neighborhood. Tony Niks makes great drinks alongside the atmosphere of 1960's mod art deco. A great place to go after dinner in north beach. Keep in mind it's pretty small and can get a litle tight. The best thing about this bar is little or NO TOURISTS.
author: mike m.

description: Rat Pack-ish = refined level of cool. Stiff drinks and laid back atmosphere.
author: Mike P.

description: Check out Tony Nik's on a Sunday night when Spike's working:  only a handful of people will be hanging out (as long as there are no festivals going on), and Spike knows how to pour a stiff one.
author: Jenny S.

description: One of my favorite neighborhood bars. Great selection of booze and bartender Sebastian is the man. Friendly people, good music, and i always seem to run into someone I know. Whenever people ask for a good local northbeach bar to go to, I send them there.
author: clint e.

description: Yay! This is my favorite NB hood joint thus far. The bartenders are awesome, one even gave me some hot tea! They don't usually serve it though so don't ask. Drinks are amazingly cheap. Nice, laid back place, and the clientele on a scale from one to ten is like an 8 which isn't bad at all!
author: Monica F.

description: Definitely one of the best bars in North Beach.  You won't find any of the strange Broadway Street vibe at this old school bar.  The bartenders are great and so is the atmosphere.  Great place to meet up with friends or for a first date.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
Tony Nik's is right where I live, so I'm here often.

This place is great. It's sophisticated, cozy, sexy and the bartenders are always nice and helpful. It's definately a neighborhood bar, which somehow filters out unwanted tourists and people from other neighborhoods and keeps it a quaint North Beach scene for the most part.
author: Nicole R.

description: Great bar! Don't spend too much time in North Beach, but I forgot how great this place is. Haven't been since 2002. It was great then, and it's just as great now. Very clean. Great decor. Great cocktail selection and good staff. It's a little off the main drag, so it's pretty much a locals spot (which is a good thing). Only negative is the bathrooms. While very clean, they're smaller than a airplane bathroom. I'm a pretty big guy, so maneuvering around to wash up afterword was an adventure.
author: Josh D.

description: Sadly I brought some out of towners tonight.  It's been a while (general aversion to North Beach) and don't ordinarily bring ousiders to the quality niches in the City.  Still don't bring just anyone to the Pig.  The interlopers, however, love the city so you can't fault them, perhaps me.  Anyone who loves walking the streets and avoids the Wharf and a cable car, except the California line, deserves a shot.  Anyway...on to the review.  Good crowd, no hassles, and stiff drinks.  What more can you ask for?  Oh yeah, no day trippers.
author: Nate B.

description: i used to live around the corner and came here quite a bit. my favorite spot was the private little tables in the back area. great atmosphere, small, cozy and laid-back. everyone in here is typically late 20's/early 30's and LOCAL which i love!  the true test was when i came here one day after a long day of paintball (i was sweaty, disheveled, wearing full army fatigues splattered with bright paint!) and no one batted an eyelash at me. go tony niks!
author: Michelle I.

description: Tony Nik's is my local. So while I am willing to admit to spending far too much time there (which shows my lack of creativity) I feel that I am greatly suited to write said review.  Whether or not you enjoy Tony Nik's really depends on what you're looking for when you got out for a cocktail. If you're looking for a really sweet or highly entertaining (Tom Cruise in Cocktail-esque) bartender to make you fancy blended drinks, then this is NOT the place.  If you are looking to be considered for or to find  "The Bachelor" San Francisco male or female, once again, this is probably not the place. If you are looking for an eclectic sampling or North Beach residents (and yes we tend to at times be loud and drunk) and some tourists who are often unwisely referred to the place as another SF "attraction",  or a kick back place to hang with friends you bring with you, then Tony Nik's will be right up your alley!
author: Andrea S.

description: I never liked lemon drops before...UNTIL I CAME TO TONY NIK'S! The lemon drops are about $8, which to me isn't that bad in the city. My friend was the one who is responsible for getting me into this place. We go here every other week as part of our "bi-weekly gossip sessions." The reason why I love it so much is that on Sundays it is very quiet and chill. The ambiance is nice and the bartenders in the evening are really cool. I really believe me and my friend make Dave's shift on Sundays so much brighter! I also had the chance to meet the owners and knowing how nice and friendly they are makes it that much more enjoyable to go there. But be careful when there is a big event in the area when you go here because this bar gets packed fast! Especially during the North Beach Festival! But if you go during non-busy hours and want to chill and have a drink this is the place...and the main reason I gave it 5 stars was because the bartenders play music from their own iPods and Dave plays the greatest old school hip-hop music!
author: Christine S.

description: i like the vibe here; very low=key. usually locals only. it's not flashy, but it's nice
author: Jocelyn L.

description: great place to start a weekend in sf. i always walk down from my hotel on the hill for happy hour. not many people there at the time but a great first stop to get acclimated to the city. nice people at the bar. citysearch always rates it as a singles place, don't really get that, but then i'm in the mission by prime time.
author: Brandon M.

description: I agree with other yelpers that this is a great neighborhood bar. The bartenders are nice and friendly and they make great drinks! Good for groups, just a night cap after dinner or even in the middle of the week when no one is there...I love it! :)
author: sarah e.

description: Love Love Love this bar!! We had an engagement party here and it was an absolute blast! Tony Nik's staff and management was top notch in making our party easy and completely stress free! We brought in a few things to eat from a great deli a few doors down (La Spiaggia) and let our friends fend for themselves at the bar. The service was friendly and fast, we did a champagne toast for 35 people and had the glasses poured in less than 5 minutes, and they even heated up the arancines we brought and helped pass them out. I can't say enough nice things about the Tony Nik's family and I highly recommend this bar for anyone that wants to have a good time!
author: Moira M.

description: Great NB find - we always have a good time here.  Often we go in to grab some drinks before dinner (or after Mass *gasp*) - turns into dinner!  The bartenders are great.  It's one of those bars you feel completely comfortable walking in to and plopping down on a stool even if no one is there.  It's just that inviting.  It's great to watch people walk by outside (tourists, for example) who sort of peer into the door as if it's some sketchy bar.  You just want to yell 'keep walking!!'
author: Jocelyn D.

description: A great little local North Beach bar away from the hustle and bustle of Broadway. Don't worry, you can easily walk there from Broadway. Small with a cozy feel. Good drinks, even if you don't know the bartender personally.
author: Monica R.
